loans.name: Cecilia Nohemi

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a sus hijos de 9 meses y 11 años de edad. Cecilia se gana la vida lavando y planchando ajeno desde hace dos años. Ella desea ampliar el corredor de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compara de lámina galvanizada y madera y así poder contar con mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Cecilia is 27 years old and is a single mother of two children ages 11 years and 9 months. Cecilia earns a living washing and ironing for other people, which she has been doing for the past two years. She wishes to enlargen the corridor of her home, which is why she is asking for this loan from FUSAI. With the money, she will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal and wood in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to enlargen the corridor of her home

loans.name: Lorenza Orfilia

texts.es: Lorenza tiene 23 años de edad es soltera y habita en casa de la madre junto a su grupo familiar. Lorenza se gana la vida mediante la venta de frutas de forma ambulante lo cual le permite ganarse la vida y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Lorenza desea invertir en su vivienda ya que el material se encuentra dañado. por lo anterior Lorenza solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para reforzar la vivienda y así poder contar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Lorenza is 23 years old, single, and lives at home with her mother and some other relatives. Lorenza works selling fruit on the streets near where she lives, which permits her to earn a living and support her family with home expenses. Lorenza wishes to invest in their home, as the material it is currently made out of has been damaged. As a result, Lorenza is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized metal sheeting and beams to reinforce the home and live with greater security.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and beams to reinforce her home

loans.name: Herna Elisa

texts.es: Con mucha energía y con mucho entusiasmo Herna Elisa se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Herna Elisa tiene 58 años de edad y como toda mujer luchadora ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia. Junto a su esposo han llevado la responsabilidad del hogar y juntos van saliendo adelante y dan a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Herna Elisa desea construir un cuarto a base de lámina galvanizada y madera para brindar a su hijo un lugar más cómodo. Con esta intensión espera que FUSAI deposité su confianza en ella y le permita hacer la construcción para su querido hijo quien es su principal fuente de energía.
texts.en:
With much energy and enthusiasm, Herna Elisa approached FUSAI to ask for a loan that would enable her to improve her quality of life. 

Herna Elisa is 58 years old, and is a very hardworking woman who has spent her life trying to get ahead with her family. Along with her husband, she is responsible for her home, and together they have worked to give a better life to their children. Herna Elisa wishes to construct a room made out of sheet metal and wood, in order to provide their son with a more comfortable living space. With this goal in mind, Herna Elisa hopes that FUSAI believes in her and permits her to undertake this construction project for her dear son who is her principal source of strength.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to construct a room for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: go buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair his roof

loans.name: Doussou

texts.fr: Doussou est une promotrice qui habite dans les environs du guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22ans et le plus petit 3ans. Ainsi elle veut aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000 F pour augmenter et diversifier son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus  et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et les aider à réussir dans la vie.
texts.en:
Doussou is a promoter who lives in the area of a [UIMCEC] branch. She is married and the mother of six children, of whom the eldest is 22 years old and the youngest is three years old. Doussou would like to help her husband cover their family's everyday expenses and her children's school fees.

Doussou has more than ten years experience in commerce. Her day begins at 9 a.m. and ends at 7 p.m. She is seeking this loan of 100,000 francs to increase and diversify her stock of merchandise.

In the future, she would like to increase her revenue, improve her children's living conditions, and help them succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes to resell

loans.name: Rina Damaris

texts.es: Rina tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 4 años de edad y su compañero de de vida. Rina trabaja como empleada en una tienda y además, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de chatarra el cual lo administra junto a su compañero de vida y juntos van saliendo adelante y dan a su hijo lo necesario. Rina desea invertir en su negocio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de más chatarra para la venta que es el negocio que les permite ajustar para las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Rina is 25 years old and lives in a house with her husband and 4 year old son. Rina works as a shop attendent, but also has her own small business selling scrap material which she runs with her husband. Together, they are working hard to get ahead and provide their son with all that he needs. 

Rina wishes to invest in her business, which is why she is asking FUSAI for this loan. With the money, she will buy more scrap material to sell, which will enable her to cover the needs of her home.

loans.use: to buy more scrap material for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and lime for her business selling tortillas

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 15 años y un año de edad. María se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace más de 6 años y este negocio es el que le ha permitido llevar  el sustento a su hogar. María desea hacer crecer su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir (faldas, pantalones, blusas, etc.) para la venta y así lograr su objetivo de conquistar un mercado más grande y así lograr incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en: María is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters, ages 1 year and 15 years old. María works selling a variety of articles of clothing, such as skirts, pants, blouses, etc. She makes her sales on the streets near where she lives, and for the past 6 years this business has enabled her to support her home. María hopes to grow her business, which is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to purchase a variety of clothing to sell. This way, she will gain greater market share and improve her sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing (such as skirts, pants, blouses, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has two children who are still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Chizi has been operating a cafe, making comestables like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread), which she sells to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients for her business, including onions, tomatoes, and cooking oil. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her business, including onions, tomatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Wilfredo Edenilzon

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y su hermano. Wilfredo trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Él es un joven muy responsable y desea apoyar a su familia mejorando las condiciones a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso, ventanas y puertas de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, grava, puertas y ventanas para encementar el piso de la vivienda y dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 21 years old and lives in his own house with his mother and brother. Wilfredo works as an employee at a business near his home. He is a very responsible young man and wants to help his family, improving their conditions. For this reason, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in improving the floor, windows, and doors of his home. He needs materials, such as: cement, sand, gravel, doors, and windows to concrete the floor of their home and give his family greater security.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, doors, and windows to cement the floor of his home and give his family greater security.

loans.name: Maria Bernalda

texts.es: María tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. María se dedica a la venta de pollos y hojas de banano las cuales son muy demandadas para la preparación de tamales que es una comida típica del país. María desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en a compra de lámina, cemento, arena, hierro y ladrillo y así poder contar con mayor comodidad.
texts.en: María is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children who are 7 and 11 years old. Both children are in school. María works selling chickens and banana leaves, which are in high demand for the preparation of tamales which is a typical food of El Salvador. María wishes to construct a bedroom in her home, which is why she is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand, iron bars, and bricks. With these materials, she will be able to build the room and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand, iron bars, and bricks to construct a room

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has three children, aged 25, 20 and 18 years, whom she supports. This is her second loan, and she is borrowing KES 20,000 now. She was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by the Visionfund officer.

Binti has a cafe; her business is located at Kijiwetanga. She has been in this business for two years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 7550. She’s planning to use the loan to purchase cooking oil and flour, in bulk, to make food for sale to her customers. She will use the profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a hotel and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and flour, in bulk

loans.name: Zawasi

texts.en:
Zawasi is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She is married and has four children, two in school and two underage for school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zawasi has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past four years. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support, to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Medina

texts.ru: Медине 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старшая дочь - студентка Аграрной Академии, остальные дети-школьники. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. У Медины - средне-специальное образование, окончила училище, по специальности - товаровед, по окончанию училища работала в магазине, затем вышла замуж за Темира и занялась домашним хозяйством. Супруг работает кочегаром в бане, имеет стабильный доход. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Медина занимается земледелием, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Медины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,2 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивают фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Медина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Медина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Medina is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Her eldest daughter is a student at the Agricultural Academy; the rest of her children are in primary school. Medina has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from an academy with a degree in merchandizing. After graduating from academy, she worked in a store, then she married her husband Temir and became a homemaker. Her husband works as a coal tender in a bank and has a steady income. As the main source of income for her family, Medina practices farming. She started this business 15 years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Medina's hard work, she currently has a 1.2 hectare plot of land, on which she grows beans sale every year. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Medina turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Medina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Turkan

texts.en:
Türkhan is married and has three children. She had made handicrafts but earned little. She looked into what else she could do and tried selling children’s clothing and jewelry. She began looking for capital when she was successful and learned about Maya’s microloans. She used a loan from Maya to start and develop her business. Now she is preparing for the spring months. She lives in a small town on the shore and wants to open a stand on the beach where she can sell what she makes. She is an energetic and talented woman. She has the competence, courage and leadership qualities to get through anything.



Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff



Türkan Hanım,evli ve 3 çocuğu var. Elişleri yapıyor ama az kazanıyor. Ne yapabilirim diye araştırıyor. Bujiteri ve çocuk çamaşırı satışı için deneme yapıyor. Başarılı olunca sermaye arayışına giriyor.

Maya mikro kredi ile tanışıyor. Maya’dan kredi alıp işe başlıyor.İşini geliştiriyor. Şimdi bahar ayına hazırlık yapıyor. Bir sahil kasabasında yaşıyor. Sahilde,stand açıp,yaptığı elişlerini burada satmak istiyor.

Aktif ve yetenekli bir kadın. Her işin altından kalkabilecek yetkinlikte,cesur,liderlik vasfı taşıyor.

loans.use: to sell what she makes

loans.name: Glenda Liseth

texts.es: Glenda de 23 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad. Glenda se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y así lleva el sustento a su hogar. Glenda desea terminar su vivienda la cual no ha logrado terminar por falta de recursos económicos y es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así finalizar su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Glenda is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 year old son. Glenda has worked as a housekeeper for many years, which is how she is able to sustain her home. Glenda wishes to finish constructing her house, which she has not been able to do as a result of limited economic resources. For this reason, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron bars. She hopes to receive this loan, and as a result finish her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron bars to construct her home

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman, and she has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sweets, ground nuts, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase foods to sell at her kiosk, including wheat flour, ground nuts, and milk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has five children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second-hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business.

Joyce is requesting a loan of KES 50,000. She will use it to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, eggs and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: Amadeo tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 19 años, 18 años, 12 años y 7 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Amadeo es agricultor y cultiva principalmente frijoles, tomates, pepinos y rabanos. Amadeo es un hombre muy dedicado a su familia y busca las formas de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Amadeo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de las paredes de la cocina ya que la tiene al aire libre. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Amadeo is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children ages 19, 18, 12, and 7 years old. All of their children are currently in school. Amadeo is a farmer who mainly cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes. He is very dedicated to his family, and is always looking for ways to improve their living conditions. Amadeo is asking for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of walls for his kitchen, which is currently open to the air. With the amount requested, he will be able to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron bars, in order to proceed with construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron bars to construct the walls of his house

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos y nietos. Pilar es una mujer muy trabajadora quien no se cansa de trabajar duramente y dar a su familia mejores condiciones. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia y una tortillería. De esta forma se gana la vida y da a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Pilar solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado por causa del tiempo y las lluvias. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Pilar is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her chidren and grandchildren. Pilar is a very hardworking woman who doesn't tire of working hard to give her family a better quality of life. With much effort, she has managed to establish a small store in her home, as well as a tortilla making business. Through these activities, she is able to earn a living and provide for her family. Pilar is asking for this loan from FUSAI in order to improve the roof of her home, which has deteriorated over time due to rain. With the amount she is requesting, she will be able to buy the sheet metal and wood required to do so.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est crée depuis Mai 2007.il est composé de membres qui habitent dans la même ville.elles ont comme activité le commerce de vêtements et de chaussures.

Diénaba qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et âgée de 38 ans.Son activité est le commerce de vêtements et de chaussures.

Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour une valeur de 125000f et des chaussures pour 75000f.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de commerce pour l'avoir exercé pendant ces cinq dernières années. 

Avec le bénéfice issu de la vente, elle désire renforcer son épargne et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2007. It is composed of members who live in the same town and sell clothing and shoes.

Diénaba, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 38 years old and married. She sells clothing and shoes. With her loan, she plans to buy 125,000 francs worth of clothing and 75,000 francs worth of shoes. She does well with this type of business, due to her five years' experience.

Diénaba wishes to use her earnings to increase her savings and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia immigrated just four years ago from Russia. Eventually she chose Haifa as her home to thrive both professionally and personally. Sofia has a degree in art and decided to stop working at simple day jobs and start to develop her dream. Sofia is developing a coffee bar studio where she will also provide art lessons and trainings. After helping her friend design and renovate a bar coffee shop, Sofia is now ready to take on her business. Together with her friend she is renovating the bar to include a studio and branch out the business. The location is perfect for such a business and the business has real potential.

Sofia needed this loan to pay for materials for studio renovations, paint, flooring, art supplies and materials needed for private and group lessons.

Sofia is working to develop an art hub where live performances will be available in the evenings, jam sessions, art shows as well as private and group lessons. She is making her dream a reality one phase at a time.

loans.use: to pay for materials for studio renovations, paint, flooring, art supplies and materials needed for private and group lessons.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 10 años y 4 años de edad. María trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles mejores condiciones. María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y francés de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Actualmente, María no cuenta con agua potable por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión del servicio del agua potable en su vivienda que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: María is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her two children ages 10 and 4. María works very hard to provide for her children and give them better living conditions. María works making sweet breads, which she sells on the streets near where she lives. Currently, María does not have potable water in her home. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in connecting her home to the potable water source, which is something she desperately desires.

loans.use: to connect her house to a potable water source

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Fatimata est une femme promotrice qui vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Vue la cherté de la vie, elle a décidé de prendre son destin en main. Elle a commencé avec son propre épargne pour faire de la vente de prêt à porter. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et détient une expérience de 4ans dans cette activité. Fatimata commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 13h. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses articles. Grace aux crédits de l’institution, elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatimata is a promoter who lives with her children and husband. Given the rising costs of living, she decided to take matters into her own hands. With her own savings, she started to sell ready-to-wear clothing, a business she has now been doing for four years. She starts her day at 10 a.m. and finishes at 1 p.m. She helps her husband with the family expenses.

Fatimata needs this loan to increase her stock and to diversify her goods. 

Thanks to this institution's loan [program], she wishes to increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to resell

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es: A sus 38 años de edad Delmy se dedica a la elaboración de chocolate de forma artesanal y a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad y muchas personas dan referencia de la integridad de Delmy. Con el fin de brindar mejores condiciones a su familia ha tomado la decisión de construir una fosa séptica para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del material necesario como: cemento, ladrillo, arena y grava.
texts.en: Delmy, 38 years old, works making artisanal chocolates and as a housekeeper. She is a very well-known woman in her community, and many people can vouch for Delmy's integrity. In order to provide her family with better living conditions, she has decided to construct a septic tank for their home. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI in order to buy the necessary materials, such as cement, bricks, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and gravel to construct a septic tank

loans.name: Sanabel

texts.en:
Sanabel is a 36 year old mother of three from northern Israel. She opened a cosmetics and hair salon in a separate area of her home. Sanabel is a charismatic, bright woman who stays up on the latest styles and treats each customer with care and professionalism. She is known for her styles and good taste.

Sanabel needed this loan to purchase hair styling materials, creams, straightener machine, hair coloring, a new door for her entrance and minor renovations.

Sanabel wants to one day build a cottage salon next to her home and expand it to accommodate customers from the surrounding area.

loans.use: To purchase hair styling materials, creams, straightener machine, hair coloring, new door for the salon entrance and minor renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair spray and others for her business.

loans.name: Bendecido Group

texts.en:
THE FRIENDSHIP BRIDGE TRUST BANK “BENDECIDO”
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bendecido” meaning “Blessed” is located outside of Chichicastenango, Guatemala and is composed of nine women who are ready to begin a new loan cycle. The ladies are mostly involved in the production of beautiful, traditional textiles which are proudly worn by indigenous women throughout Guatemala.
The current President of the Trust Bank is 34 year old Ana who has four children who range in age from one to sixteen years of age. Ana will use he loan to purchase a variety of materials to create beautifully fabricated napkins and textile with the goal of increasing her customer base. 
Ana, along with her husband, want to keep their children in school because they realize that education is a key to a more successful future. Neither Ana or her husband had any kind of formal education. 
Through the Friendship Bridge Micro-credit Plus program, Ana and her fellow Trust Bank members receive non-formal educational trainings in their monthly meetings with a Loan Officer from the organization. Relevant and useful topics covered include business management and money management, women’s identity and leadership, health and nutrition and self-esteem. The ladies share that they are very eager to empower themselves through these most useful trainings which boost their self-confidence!
The entire group is keenly aware of their responsibilities and commitment to pay back the funds that they receive from KIVA investors. They express their deepest gratitude to each investor for believing in them and for providing an opportunity to create a more successful and prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community outside of Chichicastenango!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of materials to create beautifully fabricated napkins and textiles

loans.name: Flor Del Lago Atitlan Group

texts.en:
TRUST BANK “FLOR DEL LAGO ATITLÁN”
Lake Atitlan in Guatemala is the deepest lake in Central America. It is a place of staggering beauty with three volcanoes rising up at its edges. It has been called “el ombligo del mundo” or “the belly button of the world.” and travelers from throughout the world flock to its unspoiled shores. Unique Mayan villages like Santiago Atitlan, San Juan La Laguna and Santa Catarina Palopo dot the Lake and they are full of traditional Mayan culture. The economy is based on agriculture as well as the production and sale of handicrafts. 
On the southwest part of the Lake, the newly formed Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Flor del Lago Atitlan” is ready to empower themselves and leave poverty behind. It is composed of seven young women who are eager to develop themselves and their businesses. They have requested a loan with Friendship Bridge, attracted not only by the microloans, but also by the educational trainings on subjects like effective business practices, indebtedness, health and nutrition as well as self esteem and women’s rights.
Eva is a 19 year old unmarried member of the Trust Bank. She just graduated from high school with a degree in the medical field. As Eva was unable to find a job, she decided to continue with the business that her mother started two years ago which involves the sale of cosmetics. As more clients are patronizing the business, Eva decided to request a loan from Friendship Bridge. She will use the funds to purchase additional cosmetics and increase her inventory. Eva is committed to increasing the living standard of her family and is working hard to accomplish this goal.
The ‘Flor del Lago Atitlan” Trust Bank has elected Eva to be the Secretary because she has many useful skills and talents. She is enjoying this role and is appreciative that she can serve the group. On behalf of the ladies in the Trust Bank, Eva expresses gratitude to all KIVA investors for believing in the goals and dreams of herself and the other members of the Trust Bank. All of the women are committed to repaying the funds for this loan cycle and look forward to future loans.They have a clear vision of a successful and more prosperous future for themselves and their families!

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.en:
Bella vista

In San Pedro La Laguna, Guatemala a place well known for its arts and the natural dye technique that its women use for their textiles, a trust bank called Bella Vista, formed a few years ago. Now with 7 members they are starting their fourth loan cycle with Bridge Friendship

One of the group leaders as well as the president for this new cycle is Julia, a 46-year- old, who we described as an enterprising woman. She is moving forward in her development taking advantage of her 7 years of formal education, an advantage not shared by many women of her age and from her community who were unable to learn to read and write. 

Julia is now applying for a new loan which she will invest in the purchasing of materials such as thread in good quantity and quality in order to make tablecloths, hipiles, napkins and other items. Her current customers have already ordered some products and others are purchased by tourists visiting the beautiful town that lies on the shores of Lake Atitlan Guatemala.

Julia emphasizes that she enjoys the monthly meetings with her partners where they receive discuss topics like: Business administration, money management, self-esteem, leadership and identity of women, among others topics. She says she learns a lot due to the opinions and experiences of her colleagues.

Ladies of the Bella Vista trust bank thank every KIVA investors who enable them to have access to a microcredit, which benefits both them and their families.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as thread in good quantity and quality to make more textiles

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional personal products to sell for her business.

Valentina has been in this business for 35 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional personal products to sell.

loans.name: Auring

texts.en:
Auring is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap, etc. to sell.

Auring has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Auring would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.en:
After a successful first loan cycle financed by KIVA investors, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Arca de Noe” or “Noah’s Ark”, has decided to apply for its second loan. The group is currently composed of twelve members. It is located in the busy commercial neighborhood of San Antonio, Quetzaltenango in Guatemala. Most of the women are involved in food production, selling bakery items or tortillas. Others have small stores with items for daily consumption. 

Lisbeth is a 21 year old member of the Trust Bank with two children, ages five and eight. She is married to a bricklayer. She started a hotdog business a few years back and currently the business is doing quite well. Lisbeth wants to inject more financial capital in the business and so she has requested a new loan which will be used for the purchase of supplies to produce more hotdogs. Since the school year began she wants to increase her business. Her future plans are to sell Mexican tortas or sandwiches.

The women of the Trust Bank, "Arca de Noe", enjoy being together and offering eachother support. They look forward to their monthly meetings where they not only make payments on their loans, but also receive valuable and useful educational training from a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank officer on subjects like effective business practices, money management, children’s health and nutrition, as well as women’s rights and self esteem. Lisbeth and her fellow Trust Bank members face a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty because of their own efforts as well as their association with KIVA and Friendship Bridge. They express their gratitude to both organizations!

loans.use: To purchase supplies to produce more hotdogs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 29 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. Myrna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags for her business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 60 years old and widowed with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, soft drinks, biscuits and other grocery items to sell.

Rizalina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from being a rice dealer.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, biscuits and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Agnes runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 10 años, 6 años y 4 años de edad. Miguel se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento  a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Miguel desea invertir en el cambio del techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando es tiempo de lluvia  el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Miguel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their 3 children, ages 10, 6, and 4. Miguel has worked in the security services industry for a long time and this is how he supports his household and provides his family with the necessary things.

Miguel hopes to invest in the replacement of the roof of his home since it is deteriorating. During the rainy season, the water leaks through and damages his few possessions. Miguel requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate and wood to make the repairs as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized laminate and wood to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María tiene 19 años de edad y es una joven que se encuentra acompañada y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Juntos están comenzando a formar su hogar ya que desean contar con buenas condiciones para cuando los hijos lleguen. María trabaja en una tienda desde hace 3 años y su compañero de vida es albañil y de esta forma se ganan la vida y luchan por mejores condiciones de vida. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y si le alcanza desea construir la cocina.
texts.en: Maria is a young woman of 19 years old, who lives in her own house along with her life companion. Together they are starting to improve their home, since they wish to have the proper conditions for when they finally decide to have kids. Maria has worked in a store for the past 3 years, and her companion is a construction worker. This is how they make a living and fight for better living conditions. Maria is requesting this loan to FUSAI to use it in the purchase of sand, cement and gravel to put concrete on their current dirt floor. If there’s money left, she would like to build the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy: sand, cement and gravel to put a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Dyan Rose

texts.en:
Dyan Rose is 22 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Dyan Rose requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Dyan Rose has been farming rice for 2 years and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Dyan Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, yeast, etc

loans.name: Munara

texts.ru: Мунаре 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Мунары - неоконченное-высшее образование, супруг таксует. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мунара занимается разведением скота, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мунары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 7 лошадей, 1 теленок. Дополнительно Мунара занимается выпечкой кондитерских изделий и реализует оптовым продавцам за определенную цену. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мунара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома.
texts.en: Munara is 27 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Munara has an unfinished higher education. Her husband is a taxi driver. As the main source of income for her family, Munara practices livestock breeding. She started this business 8 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Munara's hard work, she currently has 5 milk cows, 7 horses and 1 calf on her farm. In addition, Munara bakes pastries and sells them to wholesale vendors for a set price.  Their monthly joint income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Munara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Munara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Jocel has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Raquel works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Raquel is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc for her general store business.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 39 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Sheryl requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Sheryl has been farming rice for 18 years and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Sheryl would like to save money to buy farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Naimkul

texts.ru: Наимкул проживает в кишлаке и содержит большую семью, имеет четырёх детей. Все они ходят в среднюю школу. Он в основном занимается  животноводством, а также работает в стройках. В полевых работах ему в основном помогает жена Махфират. Наимкул обратился  в нашу организацию 2 раз. Бизнес начинал с двух голов мелкого рогатого скота и в данное время он довел количество скота до 4 голов. Откармливает скот и продает его на мясо и на доходы от этого бизнеса вкладывает на улучшения жилищных условий. Наимкул хочет купить скот для увеличения оборотного капитала. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 Сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Naimkul lives in a village and supports his large family, which includes four children. All of his children are in secondary school. He primarily practices livestock breeding, but also works on construction sites. His wife, Makhfirat, mainly helps him with the field work. Naimkul has requested a loan from IMON International twice. His business began with two goats. Currently, he has increased his number of livestock to four animals. He fattens them up and sells them for meat. He invests the money from this business in improving his living conditions. Naimkul wants to buy cattle to increase his working capital. He is requesting a loan for 1,500 somoni to purchase cattle. He awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital.

loans.name: Maira Lisseth

texts.es: María tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 5 años de edad. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace más de tres años y de esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su hija lo necesario. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesita material como: lámina galvanizada y madera para hacer el cambio del material del techo lo antes posible dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and lives in a house of her own with her five-year-old daughter. María has been working as a housekeeper for more than three years and this is how she sustains her family and gives her daughter everything she needs.

With the aim to improve her living conditions, she decided to request a loan at FUSAI. She will fix her roof, and for this she needs to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood. She wants to fix the roof as soon as possible because it is in bad shape.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to fix her roof.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Con 55 años de edad Mario trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y dar mejores condiciones de vida. Mario habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 16 años y 22 años de edad y se se gana la vida trabajando como albañil y en la agricultura. Él es muy conocido en su comunidad como un hombre responsable y dedicado a sus hijas. Mario ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Mario, 55, works hard to get ahead with his family and improve their living conditions. Mario lives in a house of his own, together with his daughters, aged 16 and 22. He makes a living working as a mason and in agriculture. His neighbors think he is a responsible man, devoted to his daughters.

Mario has decided to go to FUSAI. He wants to improve the floor of his house, so he needs to buy materials such as cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to fix the floor of his house.

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es: Eva tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 19 años y su hija de 11 años de edad. Eva es pequeña comerciante de productos de belleza por catalogo. La venta la realiza desde hace más de 10 años por lo que ya cuenta con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Eva desea mejorar el piso de los cuartos de la vivienda dado que por el momento son de tierra y desea darles mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava.
texts.en:
Eva is 42 years old. She lives in a house of her own with her 19-year-old son and her 11-year-old daughter. Eva is a small businesswoman who sells beauty products on a catalogue. She has been doing this for more than ten years, so she has a fixed customer base. Her customers become more loyal every day.

Eva wants to improve the earthen floor of the rooms in her house. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions. This is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy sand, cement and gravel.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and gravel to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: Maxima Rosalva

texts.es: Maxima tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 14 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Maxima se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Maxima solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea encementar el corredor de su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y cuando llueve se inunda causando insalubridad. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Maxima is 45 years old and lives in her own house, along with her life companion and her young son of 14 years old, who attends to the public school of the locality. Maxima has provided domestic services for a long time now, and this is how she a makes a living and supports her family. 

Maxima is requesting a loan to FUSAI because she wishes to put concrete on the passageway of her house, since currently it has a dirt floor and when it rains the passageway floods, making it an unhealthy place to be.  With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel to put concrete on the passageway of her house.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 45 years old and married with one child who is in school. Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as soaps, milk, sugar, spices, chips, etc.

Melba has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, such as soaps, milk, sugar, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives and does farming in Siongiroi area of South rift Kenya. She is married and has five children. She loves farming and the profit she gets out of it, and has been doing agriculture for 10 years. 

Her primary income source comes from dairy and rabbit products,and vegetable and horticulture crops.

Catherine chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their low interest rates on the loans. She learned that MFIs (microfinance institutions) does assist low income earners to grow economically. This loan will help boost her source of income and thus improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 46 years old and has two children. Rosalina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalina has been farming vegetables for 27 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Blanca se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de forma ambulante desde hace más de 5 años. Blanca ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño con ducha para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Blanca tiene plena confianza que con lo que percibe de su negocio logrará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Blanca is 29 years old and lives in her own house, along with her life companion and her daughter of 12 years old, who is currently studying. Blanca has sold secondhand clothes as a street vendor for over 5 years now. She has decided to request this loan to FUSAI to use it in the construction of a bathroom with a shower, for which she needs to buy materials, like: bricks, cement, sand and iron. Blanca is confident that with her earnings, she’ll be able to pay for this loan.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand and iron, to build a bathroom with a shower.

loans.name: Cruz Alberto

texts.es: Cruz tiene 35 años de edad y habita  en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Cruz se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 10 años. Cultiva principalmente maíz, frijol y maicillo. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda y así poder contar con mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Cruz is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their young 4-year-old daughter. Cruz has been working in agriculture for 10 years mainly cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum. 

In order to improve his and his family’s living conditions he is requesting this loan from Fusai to invest in the purchase of zinc-coated steel sheet and wood to repair the roof of his house and this way improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase zinc-coated steel sheet and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice gains to resell in her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice gains to resell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 42 years old and has four children. Marlyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marlyn has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch (in photo) lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are garment factory workers and another one attends school. 

Sreytouch and her husband are rice farmers. She is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to school. Because her son commutes to school by bicycle, taking a bicycle is tiring.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to get school.

loans.name: Malasia Group

texts.en:
Phibe, who is a widowed woman in her early 40s, has two sons who are in school. Phibe makes her living by running a business selling clothes and a operating a general store. Phibe has been in these businesses for seven years now and she operates them from 7am to 9pm each working day. She is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Phibe's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy new, fashionable clothes and new shop products to resell. Phibe dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Malasia Group, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new, fashionable clothes and new shop products to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been pig fattening for five years, and earns additional income from motorcycle transport services and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Long is 33 years old and a mother blessed with two children who are too young for schooling. 

To support her family, rice cropping and sesame farming are the businesses that her entire family rely on and they have generated her about USD 7 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Long with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely repaid her past loan with a good improvement in her living conditions. 

For this cycle, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds. She hopes that she can earn more income to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marlene has been in this business for three years. Marlene earns more income from buy-and-sell banana.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Arlene engages in a vegetable-vending business to help her husband in generating income. She is 38 years of age and has three children attending school. Together with her husband, they dreamed to become financially stable in order to educate their children and to give them a bright future. In this regard, they planned to improve their sources of living in order to satisfy their daily necessities. 

To improve their business, Arlene is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of eggplants, okra, squash, onions, tomatoes, beans, and cabbage to sell. She hope that, someday, she will be able to make more improvements in her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggplants, okra, squash, onions, tomatoes, beans, and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Melba has been in this business for 15 years. Melba earns more income from food vending and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Aprila

texts.en:
To help ease the hardships of life, Aprila helps her husband cultivate their farmland by planting vegetables for sale. She is 34 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school. Being responsible parents, Aprila and her husband aim to improve their living standards in order to educate their children and give them a better life. 

To this end they wish to expand their vegetable plantation to increase production. Aprila is therefore requesting a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She  hopes that this loan will enable them to improve their production and their profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vivincia is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Vivincia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing materials and gear for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

Vivincia has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de 2 años  de edad. Ana trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que sus vecinos dan buenas referencias de su persona. Ana desea mejorar el piso de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir e la compra de arena, cemento y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda y así  brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Ana, age 23, lives in her own house with her little two year old daughter.  Ana works as an employee of an institution close to where she lives.  This is how she manages to support her household.  She is a very hard-working and responsible woman.  Therefore, her neighbors give her good references.

Ana wishes to improve the floor of her house.  That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy sand, cement, and gravel to cement the floor of her house.  This way she will provide her daughter with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Yav's Group

texts.en:
Yav is a 33-year-old married mother blessed with three children, two of whom are in school, while one is yet too young to attend. To support her entire household, for 10 years she has been farming rice as her main business, while also working for others for a fee; as well, she catches fish to supplement her income. 

Yav has had three previous loans with Kiva partner VisionFund, all of which she has repaid, and all of which improved her lifestyle. Now she has joined a group of three to request a new loan. As the leader, Yav will spend her entire portion to pay for labor costs, a plowing fee, a fertilizer fee and insecticide. She hopes to improve her income with this loan.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs, plowing fee, fertilizer fee and insecticide

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Amelita requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Amelita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Rosa Laura

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Rosa se gana la vida lavando y planchando ajeno desde hace más de 5 años. Es así como junto a su esposo llevan la economía del hogar y dan a su familia lo necesario. Rosa desea mejorar un cuarto de la vivienda el cual está construido a base de adobes por lo que las paredes son vulnerables para que los animales aniden en ellas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena y así repellar lo antes posible las paredes para dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 36, lives in her own house with her family.  Rosa has been earning a living by washing and ironing for others for over five years.  This is how she, together with her husband, supports their household and gives their family what it needs.

Rosa wishes to improve a room in her house.  It is built from adobe, and the walls are therefore susceptible to animals nesting in them.  That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls as soon as possible.  She will do this to provide her family with greater security.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and galvanized laminate to repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron to build a fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng (in photo), age 59, has been married since 1979 and has five children. He lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Heng raises cows at home. Anyway, some parts of his house are breaking down, especially the walls; he wants to make the repairs. But, he does not have money. That’s why he decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to repair the house where he lives

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es: Lisseth tiene 20 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de pollos desde hace más de dos años. Lisseth es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en casa familiar. Ella es una joven emprendedora quien desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Con la intensión de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de su vivienda, dado que desea pintar las paredes, enladrillar el piso y poner la ventana frontal de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, pintura y una ventana.
texts.en: Lisseth is 20 and has sold chickens for over two years. She is single and lives with her parents in the family home. She is a young entrepreneur who wants to improve her living conditions and those of her family. With the goal of improving her living conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in improving her home. She wants to paint the walls, put in a brick floor, and install the front window. With this loan, she will purchase cement, sand, bricks, paint, and a window.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, paint, and a window in order to paint and add bricks to her home.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es: José tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 años y 2 meses de edad. José se dedica a la venta de verduras, hortalizas y granos básicos desde hace más de cinco años. José desea construir un cuarto para la cocina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso pero si cuenta con la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
José, age 31, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children.  One child is four years old, and the other is two months old.  José has been selling vegetables, greens, and basic grains for over five years.

José wishes to build a room for a kitchen.  In order to do so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron.  He hopes to be able to count on this loan because he does not have the capital available for this expenditure.  However, he does have the ability to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Rene Ismael

texts.es: Rene tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Rene trabaja como jornal cuidando unas peceras por lo que percibe un ingreso que le permite ajustar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Además, también cultiva una manzana de maíz lo cual pone una parte a la venta y el resto lo deja para el consumo diario. Rene desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado y desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rene is 37-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and 12-year old son.  Rene works as a day laborer taking care of some fish tanks.  The income he receives gives him the balance to cover his household expenses.  In addition, Rene plants a plot of land with corn.  He sells a portion of the corn and the rest is put aside for the family's use.  Rene wants to improve his home's roof, as it is in disrepair.  He wants his family to have a greater degree of safety.  Because of this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal and wood to start the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood to replace his roof.

loans.name: Asiscla

texts.en:
Asiscla is 46 years old and widowed with four children.

Asiscla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc.

Asiscla has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling dry goods.

Asiscla aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange lives in Nyamagabe District, the poorest in Rwanda. Motivated by the poverty and malnutrition he saw in his community, Ange made a commitment at age 7 to devote his life and work to integrating poverty reduction, food security, and environmental protection in Nyamagabe.

Last year, he created BIOCOOP RWANDA, a youth cooperative made up of 600 members to improve opportunities for people living in the district. Already, BIOCOOP has launched projects on youth entrepreneurship, water and sanitation, dairy processing, soil improvement and composting, and ICT training. Thus far, BIOCOOP has created more than 200 jobs, and improved nutrition and access to food sources. Over the next 5 years, BIOCOOP aims to create 5,000 jobs in Nyamagabe. 

BIOCOOP's flagship project is its dairy processing plant. By partnering with local farmers, BIOCOOP receives about 1,000 liters of milk per day, processes the milk, and sells the milk in the local market and at the neighboring refugee camp. At present, the demand for milk far exceeds BIOCOOP's current capacity to process milk. The main reason is that transporting raw milk from farther away farms to BIOCOOP's processing center is very costly and difficult without a vehicle.

This loan will enable BIOCOOP to purchase a tricycle motorcycle so that they can collect raw milk from farther away villages, process more, and sell the milk to more customers in the district. With this tricycle motorcycle, BIOCOOP will be able to increase from processing 1,000 liters to more than 3,000 liters per day.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle motorcycle for his milk processing center so that he can collect and deliver more milk daily for the surrounding community, including one of Rwanda's largest refugee camps.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and single. She owns and manages a small variety store and eatery within her community. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to generate a higher income. This will enable her to help her parents in financing the education of her younger sisters and save for her future.

Maricel plans to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers’ demand, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of grocery items and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in her eatery. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of grocery items and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in her eatery

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 48 years old and married with four children. Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as bread, noodles, laundry soap, shampoo, etc.

Beatriz has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as bread, noodles, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. 

Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as bread, noodles, laundry soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

Meriam has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Meriam is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell such as cucumber, squash, beans, etc.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as cucumber, squash, beans, etc.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena mayor de edad, casada, con dos hijos aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, ella es una micro empresaria la cual se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general variada como: camisas, pantalones, mochilas, bolsos, zapatos, entre otros. Las compras las realiza al contado en mercados de este municipio, también sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, desde muy temprano ella sale a ofrecer sus productos a determinados lugares de este municipio y lo hace  de forma ambulante. El objetivo de este crédito es para surtir en el negocio y poder cubrir con encargos que tiene como: mochilas, sandalias, carteras, uniformes entre otros productos. Martha Lorena esta agradecida con los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y a países pobre como Nicaragua.
texts.en: Martha Lorena is elderly, married, and has two children under her care.  She is from Chinandega, located in the west part of the country and has a small company where she sells general merchandise, such as shirts, pants, book bags, purses, shoes, and other things.  She makes her purchases in cash at the city market and sells for cash or credit to steady and new customers.  She gets up very early to go out and offer her products on foot.  Her goal for this loan is to stock her business and be able to cover her customer orders for things like book bags, sandals, wallets, uniforms, etc.  Martha Lorena is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they provide people from poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a hard working mother who supports her husband in gaining income. She is 60 years old and has three adult-age children. She engages herself in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the Public Market. Violeta aims to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Violeta is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the said additional stock. Through this financial assistance, she hopes that she will further improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seeds, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Chona is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Chona has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Chona requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business such as shells, nylon thread, wire, etc.

Chona has been in this business for 12 years. Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business such as shells, nylon thread, wire, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 37 años de edad, es un hombre con buenos valores y principios morales, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al trabajo en panadería, tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.
 
Pedro tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, él siembra maíz y frijoles, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre la cual le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia y le genera ganancias económicas ya que vende el 40% de sus cosechas para satisfacer otras necesidades básicas del hogar. Él decidió continuar los trabajos de la agricultura, ya que su padre le heredó el terreno en donde realiza sus actividades agrícolas, en la cual también se involucra su hermano menor.
