El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, será utilizado para recoger las cosechas y llevar acabo el proceso de preparación de las mismas, ya que tendra que pagar trasporte para trasladar su cosecha del campo hacia el hogar, ademas pagará el arrendamiento de la máquina que le servirá para desgranar el maíz. Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a agilizar el proceso de preparación y almacenamiento de  su cosecha. 
  
Las metas que Pedro tiene para un futuro son, pagar el crédito actual y adquirir otro para la compra de una máquina desgranadora de maíz, brindar la educación a sus hijos, pues su hijo desea ser agrónomo y una de sus hijas quiere ser enfermera y todo esto lo logrará con la inversión eficiente de las ganancias que le generará la venta de sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old and is a man of good values and moral principles.  He didn’t have the opportunity to attend school and he is currently married.  His wife is a housewife and also works in a bakery.  He has three children who attend the local elementary school.

Pedro has been farming for 20 years and raises corn and beans.  He learned this from his father, and this allows him to support his family and generate income.  He sells 40% of his harvest to pay for other household needs.  He decided to continue farming since he inherited the land from his father.  His younger brother is also involved.

He will use the money from this loan to harvest and prepare his crops.  He will need to pay to transport his harvest to his home.  He will also pay to rent the machine he will use to thrash the corn.  The loan will help him speed up the harvest process.

Pedro’s goals for the future are to pay off this loan and get another one to buy a corn thrasher, provide an education for his children because his son wants to be an agronomist and one of his daughters wants to be a nurse.  He will do it all with efficient use of his earnings from his harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yu  Handri

texts.en:
Yu Handri is a 45-year-old man and is married to Lenny, a 37-year-old lady. Yu Handri owns a repair shop business. He has been engaged in this business for years. From the business he is able to generate money for his family's daily needs.
 
Yu Handri wants to improve his business by adding more spare parts. He was seeking capital assistance to do so. He then requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan on spark plugs, inner tubes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts such as spark plugs, inner tubes, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

Merlita has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She also earns income from rice farming and raising pigs. Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell. Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is married and works hard to support her family.  

For the past twelve years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell at her general store. Deogracia would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her general store

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto tiene 66 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Modesto se dedica  a la agricultura y a la albañilería. Todos los años siembra principalmente tomates, chile verde, maíz y frijoles. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Modesto y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes y desea construir un pequeño cuarto en su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y laminas y así poder contar con mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Modesto, 66, and his wife own the house that they live in.  Modesto is a farmer and construction worker.  He grows tomatoes, chilies, maize and beans and his income covers his everyday needs.  The house is small and Modesto wants to add a room for extra space.  He will use this FUSAI loan to buy the materials he needs--cement, sand, bricks, rebar, roofing materials, etc.--to expand his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for house addition.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 42 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming rice for ten years and earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 54 years old and married, with four children.

Dominga works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Dominga has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Dominga aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Eduardo es un hombre muy trabajador quien se gana la vida trabajando como albañil y jornalero desde hace más de 20 años. Eduardo desea termnar un cuarto dormitorio el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Eduardo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento y arena para dar fin al cuarto antes que empiecen las lluvias.
texts.en: Eduardo, 58, owns the house where he lives with his wife and children.  He is a hard-working man.  He has worked construction and other temporary jobs for 20 years to support his family.  Eduardo wants to add a bedroom to his house, a project that he started but doesn't have money to finish.  He is applying for this FUSAI loan to buy the supplies he needs--bricks, cement, sand--to finish the add-on before the coming rainy season.

loans.use: to buy materials for house addition.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 35-year-old mother who owns and manages a small variety store within her village. Despite the hardship of living, she has the determination to become successful and financially stable in the future. To attain her goal, she aims to improve her business and make it more profitable. 

Editha is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods, canned goods, noodles, breads, laundry soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that, someday, she will make her dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods, canned goods, noodles, breads, laundry soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en: Yuliana is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. Her oldest daughter is  20 and currently studying in university and her youngest child is seven years old. Yuliana has earned a living for the last two years by making handbags, bible covers and hanging bags in traditional designs and motifs. Her goal is to produce more bags and open her own kiosk so she can generate more income for her family. Therefore, she has requested a loan from TLM for IDR 4,500,000. She  will spend the loan on supplies such as threads and items for her kiosk such as soaps, detergents, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase craft and kiosk supplies.

loans.name: 01.06.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup.  She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make processed food to resell.

Thủy is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Thủy is the group leader of the 01.06.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
Thủy supports 3 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Thủy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thủy has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase material to make processed food to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum energy so that Aggrey's wife can get involved with income generating employment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking gas package in order to save on her cooking energy costs

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha (in photo), age 39, is single.  She lives with her sister and elderly parents on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sitha is a weaver.  In addition, she buys additional cotton and silk fabrics from other weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other districts away from her home.  Sitha wants to increase the volume of cotton and silk fabrics she buys and sells so that she can generate more income to better support her standard of living.  Hence she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy more cotton and silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Felisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers for her coconut vending business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: 01.04 02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thu  has a retail business selling dried food and is requesting a loan to buy rice to resell. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also leads a loan group called the 01.04.02 Đông Sơn Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has one dependent as her older child is grown. In 2010, Thu  joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu  has successfully repaid four previous loans from our organization and has been in her line of work for five years. One of her main challenges is a lack of capital. With the profits she earns from her business, she is committed to help her family be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (in the photo), age 54, is a security guard and his wife is a silk weaver. He has three sons and two daughters. All of his children are in school. 

Vanny’s family does not have enough electricity to use because they only use batteries. Facing this, he decided to apply for a loan to buy a solar home system for his family to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar home system for his family to use.

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en: Anarose is a 55-year-old mother who was gifted with two children. She supports her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. They plan to expand their rice plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the expenses incurred in planting rice. Through this loan, they believe they will improve their rice farming business and increase their production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for planting costs

loans.name: Gelmer

texts.es:
Gelmer tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, carneros, cuyes y conejos, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gelmer is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Lagunas. The people in this community engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Gelmer raises and sells small animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, and rabbits. His wife helps with the work. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for fattening his animals. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She is borrowing  8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her handicraft business. She has been in this business for eight years. Haide also earns income from a general store.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josefa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for one year now.

Josefa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en: Norlyn is 36 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them by running a business where she buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Norlyn has been in this line of work for four years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Iris Beatriz

texts.es: Iris tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad. Iris trabaja como empleada en una industria cercana a su localidad. Iris desea construir una fosa séptica y pintar las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava y pintura. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Iris is 24 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their six-year-old daughter. She is employed at a company near her town.

Iris wants to build a septic tank and paint the walls of her home, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and paint. Iris hopes to receive this loan so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a septic tank and to paint the walls of her house.

loans.name: Naning

texts.en:
Naning is 59 years old, married and has nine children.

She is in the agricultural business raising vegetables in the Philippines. Naning requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Naning has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Naning would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lezel works hard to support her family.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Lezel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, etc. for her handicraft business.

Lezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en: Ma. Ana works hard to support her family. She is married and earns a living by selling shells in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to purchase additional supplies for her business. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and would like to expand her business to better secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her business

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun (pictured here), age 40, lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four daughters. 

Yeun sells fish that her husband catches and she also buys additional fish from other fisherman to resale them in her local market. Yeun and her husband are also rice farmers when farming season comes. 

Anyway, the house where she lives is breaking down in some parts (walls).  She wants to make replacements but she does not have the money. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To replace the walls of her house.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. Due to the high cost of school fees, he aims to improve his computer shop in order to earn a higher income. He would like to do this by acquiring additional sets of computers  but he does not have enough capital to do this. For this reason, he is requesting for a loan for PHP 40,000.00 to buy more computers to rent. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his business and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy additional computers to rent

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet  de 19 años de edad, una  joven universitaria  con muchos deseos de superación y con ganas de salir adelante, Lizet estudia diseño grafico  ya que es una profesión que le gusta mucho y que la ayudara a  alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Lizet  tiene la seguridad  de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser una buena diseñadora. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio. Lizet   se encuentra muy agradecida con Kiva por la ayuda brindada y se despide con la seguridad   de culminar sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lizet is 19 years old. She is a young university student who has the drive to succeed and the desire to get ahead. Lizet is studying graphic design, a profession that she enjoys very much and will help her reach her goals in life. She is confident that she will finish her studies successfully and become a good designer.

With the loan she will receive, Lizet will pay for her university room and board, as well as buy supplies for her studies. She is extremely grateful to Kiva for the assistance that she has received. Lizet bids farewell by saying that she is confident that she can accomplish the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to pay for her room and board and to buy supplies for her university studies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 41-years-old and married with four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Marivic has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water and handicrafts.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Narsisa

texts.en:
Narsisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years now.

Narsisa requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, scissors, etc. for her business. 

Narsisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, scissors, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a loan of 9,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients like sugar, rice, milk, young coconut, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, rice, milk, young coconut, etc.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nimfa works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Nimfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 60-years-old and has five children. Two of them are still at the college level. Due to the high cost of school fees, he has engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He plans to acquire more pigs to raise, but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy the needed feed and vitamins and to buy additional piglets to raise. He believes that his loan will make it possible for him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ruben Arturo

texts.es: Ruben tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermano y sobrina. Ruben trabaja como empleado en una institución cercana a su localidad desde hace más de 10 años. Ruben desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda  para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y clavos para dar inicio a la mejora del techo lo antes posible y así dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Ruben is 31 years old and lives in his own house with his mother, brother, and niece.  Ruben has worked for an institution that is located close to his town for more than 10 years.  Ruben wants to make improvements to the roof of his house, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sheets of corrugated metal and nails to start the home improvement project as soon as possible.  This way, he can provide his family with better security.

loans.use: to repair his roof

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 37-years-old and single. She lives in a village with her beloved parents. To have additional income, she runs a small variety store and sells different grocery items, fruits and vegetables. Due to financial hardships, she aims to make her business profitable in order to satisfy their daily necessities and save some for future emergencies. She wants to increase her product offerings but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stock of groceries, rice, fruits and vegetables to resell in her store. Being patient and industrious, she believes that someday she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries, rice, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 33 years old, married and has five children, four of whom are in school.

Arcelie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arcelie has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arcelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle..

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from her general store.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools to maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ritchelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ritchelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fish net for her fishing business.

Ritchelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fish net

loans.name: Joecelle

texts.en:
Joecelle is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Joecelle has a buy-and-sell soft drinks business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, Joecelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia works hard to support her family. Lucrecia is married and has a banana and root crops vending business in the Philippines.

Lucrecia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas and root crops to sell to her customers.

Lucrecia has been in this business for three years now.

Lucrecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and root crops to sell

loans.name: Rizil

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rizil works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and fish vending. Rizil is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, fish net and other materials for her fishing business.

Rizil has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a weaving of bamboo business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Melecia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling root crops.

Melecia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and has eight children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Rosa has been raising livestock for 20 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 21-years-old and married with one child.

Rosalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like bread, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Rosalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like bread, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: María tiene 69 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y aportan a con lo que pueden a la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca desde hace más de 8 años. María  es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora quien con  mucho esfuerzo logró sacar adelante a sus hijos. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del portón de la vivienda y si le alcanza mejorará la cocina.
texts.en: Maria is 69 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her children, who are adults and contribute with what they can to the household finances. Maria has been selling milk for more than 8 years. She is a very hardworking and determined woman. With a lot of effort, she managed to get her children ahead. Maria is requesting this loan from FUSAI to repair the gate of her house and if there is enough money, to improve the kitchen.

loans.use: to repair the gate of her house and improve the kitchen.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is married and lives with his wife and four of their children. He is 51-years-old and works in agriculture. Saret tries hard to care for his crops with the hope of having more income to allow him to improve their quality of life and provide educational opportunities to his children. His wife helps share the costs of living by raising piglets at home.

Saret would like to improve his living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan in the sum of 700 USD to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen smoke from wood or charcoal. Upon construction completion, NBP provides a flat rate subsidy of 150 USD per plant into the borrower’s saving account for the purpose of making a loan repayment.  After that, HKL will reschedule a new repayment schedule with the borrower. Accordingly, there is the possibility of a small variation in the loan amount when reporting the monthly repayment to Kiva.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for nine years now and earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling nipa roofing. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a 40-year-old farmer at Amulung. He has two children. On his farm, he plants and harvests rice to sell. His income from the harvested crop goes for meals, bills at home and the education needs of his children. He also saves part of the income as revolving capital for the next planting season. He wants to keep increasing his crop production but is in need of additional capital, which is why he is asking for PHP 10,000 to invest in his farm. He will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for farming. This farm inputs will be a great help in achieving a fruitful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan de 58 años de edad,  padre de 10 hijos;  6 varones y 4 hembras estudio hasta  tercer grado comenta que  por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no logro seguir estudiando, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, actualmente en su vivienda viven 6 personas 4 hijos y su esposa y los demás hijos ya están acompañados y viven a parte, sus 4 hijos  que viven en casa actualmente se encuentran estudiando y que en los momentos libres le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas y  son las únicas personas que dependen de él.  


Juan se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol) desde que él estaba pequeño sus padres le enseñaron  a aprender este trabajo como era la única alternativa y de ingresos en aquellos  tiempos por eso se dedicaba a la agricultura. Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura, también se dedica a la ganadería posee unas vaquitas que le proporcionan leche y sus derivados para la alimentación de su familia y que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos y alimento para su familia, él para llegar a su lugar de trabajo está a unos 2 kilómetros de su vivienda le toca caminar y también  recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa para realizar los trabajos agrícolas.

   El préstamo lo utilizara para la preparación de la tierra para sembrar sus cultivos para el invierno que se acerca, el cultiva granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo) con la ayuda del préstamo le permitirá tener la tierra preparada para cuando venga el invierno, poder sembrar los cultivos más adecuadamente y eficientemente en el tiempo específico sin mayores complicaciones de perdida.

Desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia y obtener  mayor  producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean  personas profesionales y logren terminar su estudios y sacar  una carrera universitaria todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposa y mucho trabajo y por supuesto con futuros prestamos que sacara.
texts.en:
Juan is 58 years old and is the father of ten children - 6 boys and 4 girls. He has a third grade education and states that he was unable to continue his studies due to his family's financial situation. He is married and his wife takes care of running the house.  Currently six people live at home; four children, his wife and himself. The other children live on their own with their spouses. His four children who live at home are in school, and in their free time they pitch in with the agricultural chores. They are the only ones who are dependent on him.

Juan works in agriculture and grows basic grains (corn, beans). Ever since he was young his parents taught him how to do this as it was their only way to earn income at that time. In addition to the crops, he also raises cattle. He has a few cows that provide milk and dairy products to feed the family. This is another way they generate income and food for the family. Juan must walk 2 kilometers to where he works. His children and his wife help him with his agricultural work. 

He will use the loan to prepare the land to plant the crops for the coming winter. He grows basic grains (corn, beans, and sorghum). With the help of the loan, he will be able to have the land ready for planting at the most opportune time and in the most efficient and proper way, with no complications or loss.

He hopes that he and his family will have a better quality of life in the future and to increase his production of basic grains. He wants to be able to live comfortably in a dignified place for his children, and he wants his children to continue to study and get a university degree so that they will become professionals. All of this can be accomplished with his wife with much work, great effort and dedication, and of course with the loans he will ask for in the future.

loans.use: to prepare his land to plant his crops for the coming winter. He grows basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Elemie

texts.en:
Elemie is 41 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soft drinks, juice, etc. to sell.

Elemie has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Elemie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, soft drinks, and juice to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Felisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos principalmente lava y plancha ajeno. Ana reside en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 19 años y 22 años de edad. Ana y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes y desea reparar el techo de su pequeña vivienda dado que se encuentra dañado y cuando es tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and works providing domestic services, mainly washing and ironing. Ana lives in her own house with her life companion and two children 19 and 22 years old. Ana and her family live in very modest conditions and want to repair the roof of their house. It is damaged and when it rains it filters through and ruins their few possessions. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying zinc laminate and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate and wood to repair her roof.

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Welyn has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Welyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Amelita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nails, wood and paint for her furniture making business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nails, wood and paint

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es: Hipolita tiene 63 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a sus dos nietas de 8 años y 7 años de edad. Hipolita se dedica a la venta de verduras como: papas, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas,et. La venta la realiza en el mercado central de su localidad desde hace más de 20 años. Hipolita desea invertir en la conexión del agua potable dado que no cuenta con el servicio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión del agua potable lo antes posible.
texts.en: Hipolita is 63 years old and she lives in her own house with two grandchildren, aged 7 and 8. Hipolita sells vegetables like carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. She has been selling in the central market of her community for more than 20 years. Hipolita wants to invest in connecting to the water system as she does not presently have running water. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in connecting to the water system.

loans.use: to connect with the water services.

loans.name: Silvia Evelyn

texts.es: Silvia tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y sus tres hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace dos años Silvia comercializa productos helados como: refrescos, hielo y charamuscas lo cual le permite percibir ingresos para ajustar junto a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Silvia desea reparar el techo de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera y así dar inicio lo antes posible a la reparación del techo.
texts.en: Silvia is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children who are studying. For the past two years Silvia has been selling frozen products like drinks, ice and charamuscas (frozen fruit drink) which allows her to generate money to help her husband with the household expenses. Silvia wants to repair the roof of her house so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized laminate and wood so they can start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is 42 years old and married with three children. With all three children currently in school, Yolly works very hard to provide for them.

Yolly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, noodles, coffee, salt, sugar, candies, and canned goods. 

In the future, Yolly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Andrea has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dalrich

texts.en:
Dalrich is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Dalrich has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Dalrich has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 48 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañera de vida y sus 6 hijos. Francisco trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones. Él es agricultor y albañil y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Francisco solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda y no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Francisco is 48 years old and lives in very modest conditions with his life companion and 6 children. Francisco works very hard to get his family ahead and give them better living conditions. He is a farmer and a bricklayer and in this way he earns his living and supports his household. Francisco is requesting this loan from FUSAI given that he wants to improve the roof of his house but does not have the financial resources to make the payment. With the money requested he will buy galvanized laminate and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and married. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmen is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmen has been pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hermonisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Hermonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and sell-peanuts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Hermonisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her buy-and-sell peanuts business.

Hermonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Lorena

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la comercialización de frutas como: tamarindo, mangos, carao, etc. Vilma desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Vilma is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her children. For the past 5 years she has been selling fruit like tamarinds, carao (both tropical local fruits), mangos, etc. Vilma wants to improve the conditions of her house so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel to cement in the floor of the corridor of the house which is presently in a deteriorated condition.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement in the floor of the corridor in her house.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 5 años de edad. Desde hace más de 2 años marta se dedica a la venta de refrescos y pasteles de carne los cuales comercializa con mucho entusiasmo dentro de su comunidad. Marta desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento para dar inicio lo antes posible a la mejora de las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta, 28, lives in her own house with her companion and her two children, ages 8 and 5.  Marta has sold beverages and meat pies for more than two years.  She works a lot of enthusiasm in her community.

Marta wants to plaster the walls of her house, so she's asking FUSAI for this loan to buy sand and cement to start the improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster her walls

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Con 48 años de edad Rosa se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Desde hace 2 años cuida dos niños por lo que recibe un ingreso que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 19 años de edad y es por quien trabaja muy duro para darle lo necesario. Rosa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un portón grande que le permita cerrar la entrada de su vivienda y así poder dar a su hijo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: 48-year-old Rosa makes a living by offering domestic services. She has been looking after two children for the last two years, for which she receives money which allows her to provide for her household. She lives in her own house with her 19-year-old son. She works very hard so she can give her son everything he needs. Rosa is requesting this loan from FUSAI so she can invest in the purchase of a large gate, which will allow her to close off the entrance of her home and thereby give her son greater security.

loans.use: to purchase a large gate for the entrance of her home

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es: Desde hace 30 años Dilia se dedica a la venta de variedad de antojitos típicos como yuca frita, ampanadas y variedad de bebidas. La venta la realiza en un puesto fijo y de manera ambulante principalmente en paradas de buses. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ganarse el sustento diario. Dilia tiene 62 años de edad y sigue luchando con la esperanza de lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas para su vivienda dado que las que tiene  son de madera y se encuentran en mal estado.
texts.en: For 30 years Dilia has made a living by selling a variety of traditional snacks, such as yuca frita (fried cassava), empanadas, and a variety of drinks. She sells both from a fixed stall and by transporting her food around, primarily to bus stops. She is a very hard-working, responsible, and enterprising woman, who does all she can to earn a living. Dilia is 62 years old and she continues striving to improve her living conditions. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest it in buying doors for her home, since the ones she has are wood and are in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy doors for her home

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Ana tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida quien trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ana trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad y así junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar y se preparan para los futuros hijos. Ana desea construir paredes de ladrillo en la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old and resides in her own home along with her life partner. She works very hard in order to sustain her household. Ana is employed at a company that is near her town. Both she and her partner maintain the household finances so that they can prepare for their future children.

Ana wants to build brick walls in her home, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron for building the walls of her house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria del Carmen tiene 57 años es soltera y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de libreria,la socia vende cuadernos,libros,lapiceros y libros,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de libreria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Qochasaywas” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 57 years old, single, and has three children. Maria has a bookstore where she sells notebooks, books, and pens. She has been in this business for six years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her bookstore.

Maria del Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy notebooks, books, and pens. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, and pens.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander tiene 46 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad. Alexander es un albañil muy reconocido por su experiencia, actualmente trabaja para una empresa constructora realizando distintas obras de ingeniería civil. El tiene la necesidad en su vivienda de construir una habitación adicional con material resistente como lo es el bloque de concreto. Como no cuenta con el total del dinero que implica esta mejora, ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito y comprar el ladrillo de bloque de concreto, cemento, hierro, arena y grava. Alexander menciona que se ahorrará la mano de obra ya que él realizará la construcción de la habitación.
texts.en:
Alexander is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children (ages 17 and 11). He is a bricklayer who is well-known for his experience. Alexander is currently employed by a construction company that is awarded various civil engineering projects.

He needs to build an additional room in his house that is made of resistant materials, such as cement blocks. Since he does not have enough money to make this improvement, Alexander is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will buy cement blocks, cement, iron, sand, and gravel.

Alexander mentions that he will be able to save on labor costs because he will build the room himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building an additional room in his house.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Edelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline business for 5 years and also earns an income from her general store.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Marleni

texts.es:
Rosa Marleni tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de La Florida, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel que pertenece a la Provincia de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodeguita que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrece abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, dedicándose a este negocios desde hace 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Marleni is 40 years old and lives with her son in the District of La Florida. This community is devoted to agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in San Miguel Province, which is situated in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Rosa has a small grocery store in her home where she offers products such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, and cleaning supplies. She has been in this business for five years. Rosa is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN in order to buy a variety of groceries that she can offer to her customers. This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been farming sugarcane for 2 years and also earns additional income from her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salamata Demba

texts.fr: Salamata Demba  est une femme qui est veuve et mère de 2 enfants dans le plus grand a 29 ans et le plus petit a 23 ans. Elle habite dans la commune ou se situe le guichet. C’est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter et des produits divers. Elle a comme charge particulière la dépense quotidienne. Elle a une expérience de plus de 17ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses commandes. Salimata Demba  souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir ouvrir une autre boutique de prêt à porter et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses 2 enfants.
texts.en: Salamata Demba is a widow. She has two children, 29 and 23 years old. She lives in the municipality where the banc villageois branch is located and promotes the branch. She works as a vendor selling ready-to-wear clothing and miscellaneous clothing. She needs to provide for her everyday expenses. She has over 17 years of experience in this business. She starts her work day at 9 AM and ends at 7 PM. She is seeking this loan in the amount of 100,000 West African francs in order to enlarge her merchandise stock and meet customer demand. In the future, Salamata Demba would like to increase her revenues in order to be able to open another shop with ready-to-wear clothing and improve the life conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 36 años de edad es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad. Sandra trabaja de oficios domésticos en un hotel de la localidad. Ella apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, como la alimentación, pago de la energía y del agua potable. Sandra ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para ampliar la vivienda de sus padres, construyendo unas paredes de ladrillo de obra y tener un cuarto de habitación para ella y su pequeña hija. Con el dinero comprará los ladrillos de barro, cemento, hierro, arena grava y otros materiales necesarios para la construcción. Ella menciona que cumplirá con los pagos de las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 36-year-old single mother. She lives at her parents’ house with her seven-year-old daughter. Sandra performs the housekeeping duties at a hotel in her town. Her parents help her with the household expenses such as food, electricity, and water.

Sandra is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can expand her parents’ house. She will put up brick walls in order to build a room for herself and her young daughter. The money will be used to buy clay bricks, cement, iron, sand, gravel, and other needed construction materials.

Sandra says that she plans to complete her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room in her parents' house.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se siente contenta porque tiene hermosos paisajes, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas mas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz.

Tomasa agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives in the enchanting city of Cusco, which is in southern Peru. She is pleased to live there because of the beautiful landscapes.

Tomasa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is able to move her family forward. Her main business activity is selling basic necessities such as sugar, noodles, milk, and other products. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Tomasa is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. She is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 34 years old and single. She lives with her parents in a rural community. 

To have additional sources of income she is engaged in the hog-raising business. She aims to make the business more profitable to increase her income, satisfy their necessities, and save for her future. She plans to acquire more pigs to raise but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. 

Through this loan she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. 

Marisa is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle. Marisa has been raising cattle for 20 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emmalyn works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Emmalyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Remedios engages in buying and reselling bread within the town proper. She is 49 years of age, married, and was gifted with only one child. She and her husband aim to become successful and financially stable in order to sustain their necessities and give their child a better living. She plans to strengthen her business but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of breads to sell in her bakery. Through patience and strong determination, she believes that she will further improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of breads to sell in the bakery

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 39 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Wilfredo es un hombre muy trabajador él es un pequeño comerciante que tiene un local en donde vende variedad de lámparas de mano y de uso para el hogar. Él está mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para continuar con la construcción de un muro de contención al frente de su vivienda. Con el dinero comprará el resto del bloque de concreto, cemento, arena y grava además pagará la mano de obra para finalizar el muro de contención.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and three young children. He is a very hardworking gentleman. Wilfredo is a small merchant who manages a shop where he sells a variety of flashlights and lamps for household use.

He is making gradual improvements to his home, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to continue the construction of a retention wall in front of his house. The money will be used to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, and gravel. In addition, he will pay for labor in order to finish the retention wall.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor in order to finish the construction of a retention wall.

loans.name: Filiciana

texts.en:
Filiciana is 48 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Filiciana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Filiciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

Filiciana has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Filiciana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 59 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, chips, bread, etc. to sell.

Erna has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Erna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, chips, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a responsible mother who supported her husband in generating income. She is 60 years old and has two adult-age children. Aside from farming, she also accompanied her husband in operating their jeepney to be hired by the passengers. To continuously using their vehicle, Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy gasoline and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of their jeepney. She hopes that her loan request will be granted to be able for them to continue using their vehicle to generate sufficient income for their family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and other spare parts

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina is a hard working mother, who sells pork and chicken barbecue at the Public Market. She is 53 years of age, married and has five adult-age children. She wants to make her business profitable in order to meet the needs of her family, and to save for future emergencies. 

To improve her business, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines Pesos to buy raw ingredients like pork, chicken heads, feet, intestines, liver and hot dogs to be cooked and sold in the market. With this loan, she believes that she will be able to make the business profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like pork, chicken heads, feet, intestines, liver and hot dogs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and has two children. Mary Ann is married and one child is still in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 36,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 6 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 32 years old, and married with three children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has asked for a loan of 13,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns additional income from selling fish.

Mary Grace wants to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old, and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 Philippines Pesos loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like coffee, milk and soft drinks to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns an income from selling fish.

Gina hopes to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like coffee, milk and soft drinks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: To have another source of income, Josephine engages in buying and reselling Tupperware, AVON and Natasha products within her village. She is now 49 and has three children attending school. She aims to strengthen this business  to help her husband in supporting the education of their children. Due to limited capital, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of the said products to sell. Being a diligent and friendly mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Tupperware, AVON and Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
As one way of generating income, Novelyn buys and resells Liquefied Petroleum Gas(LPG) tanks within her community. It is her way of helping her husband to earn enough money. She is 37 and blessed with three children of school-age. 

Novelyn wants to make her business more profitable in order to help with the cost of educating her children. She does not have enough capital to do this, so she has asked for a loan of 5,000 Philippines Pesos to buy more stocks of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) tanks to resell in the local community. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) tanks to resell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Eduardo aims to uplift his status of living to give his family a better future. He is 47 and has only one child. Aside from farming, he also engages in buying and reselling footwear and clothes within the public market to earn additional income. 

He planned to acquire more stock of the said products to resell, but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, blouses, jackets, shorts and pants to sell. He is hoping that his loan will be a great help for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, blouses, jackets, shorts and pants to sell

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is 23 years old and married.

Renelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent soap, canned goods, juice, cereals, milk, coffee, etc., to sell.

Renelyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Renelyn aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent soap, canned goods, juice, cereals, milk, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda believes that "success is the fruit of patience and sacrifices." She is 47, married and has four children. She and her husband aim for a happy and successful life in the future. In this regard, she aims to improve her small variety store in order to increase her income. Having limited capital, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of grocery items, rice and vegetables to sell in her store. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of grocery items, rice and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: To earn additional income, Dominga engages in the buying and reselling of rice within her community. She is 52 years old and has five adult-aged children. Due to the hardship of living, she aims to strengthen the business in order to earn sufficient income. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of rice to sell in the local community. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Richel

texts.en:
Ma. Richel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She wants to borrow 20,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 15 years. Ma. Richel also earns an income from her general store.

Ma. Richel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is 40 years old, and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has asked for a 15,000 Philippines Pesos loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, rice and sardines to sell.

Nanette has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years now, and also earns an income from food vending.

Nanette aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, rice and sardines to sell

loans.name: Meminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Meminda works hard to support her family.

She has a livestock business in the Philippines, and she also earns and additional income from fish vending. Meminda has asked for a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell for her livestock business.

Meminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Melfe

texts.en:
Melfe is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Melfe is borrowin 15,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy additional goats, feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Melfe has been raising livestock for two years, and also earns additional income from selling fish.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goats, feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Rosanel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosanel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Rosanel is borrowing 11,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy additional stocks like hotdog and chicken to sell in her food vending business.

Rosanel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like hot dogs and chicken to sell

loans.name: Gloria Heriberta

texts.es: Gloria tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 2 años de edad y tres hermanos. Gloria trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y junto a su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad dan  a su familia lo necesario. Gloria solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda y no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso.
