Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Gloria, 21, lives in her own house with her common-law husband, their two-year-old son and her three siblings.  She works hard, together with her husband who works as a security guard, to give her family everything they need.

Glorida is requesting a loan through FUSAI to finish the interior walls of her house, since she cannot afford to pay for it.  She will use the loan to buy cement and sand.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to finish the interior walls of her house.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.ru: Валерия рабоатет на заводе КАБЕЛЬ. Живет в небольшом собственном доме вместе со своими родителями, где отсутствует ванная комната. Валерия хочет переделать одну из комнат под ванную. Она просит предоставить ей кредит чтобы сделать необходимые сантехнические работы (провести воду и канализацию), а также приобрести и установить ванную, умывальник и унитаз.
texts.en: Valeria works at a factory named "CABLE."  She lives with her parents in a small house that she owns.  However the house doesn't have a bathroom and Valeria wants to remodel one of the rooms into a bathroom.  She is requesting a loan in order to do all the necessary plumbing (installing water and drain pipes), and to buy a tub, sink, and toilet.

loans.use: to install a bathroom

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado  y  por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no continuo con sus estudios. Él se dedicaba a tocar música, desde que tenía 12 años le gustaba mucho la música y decidió a aprender a tocar varios instrumentos musicales.
 Actualmente, pertenece a una  agrupación internacional  El Salvador,  desde hace 4 años y cuenta con 18 años de experiencia, ya que además de pertenecer a esta agrupación de alto prestigio, es miembro de otros grupos en donde él les apoya, el toca 8 veces al mes toca 4 con el grupo y otras 4 con otro grupo musical.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar madera, adive, teja, entre otros materiales para construir su casa.  Con esto quiere darles una mejor condición de vida a sus padres  y que se sientan cómodos en su vivienda.

A futuro desea tener una casa  que le brinde buenas condiciones a su familia, que de seguridad, protección, y a la vez evitar enfermedades, para que así su familia pueda tener una mejor condición de vida y que tengan una vida sana y saludable.
texts.en:
Juan, 31, got as far as ninth grade but was unable to finish his education because of a lack of resources.  Since the age of 12 he has enjoyed music and learned to play several instruments.

Currently, he is a member of the international group El Salvador which he has been a part of four four years.  He has 18 years' experience and also plays with other bands.  He plays eight times a month, four with his own band and four with other musical groups.

The loan he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy wood, adobe, tiles and other materials to build his house.  He wants to give his parents better living conditions so they will be comfortable at home.

In the future he wants to have a house for his family which offers safety, protection and a healthy atmosphere so the family can lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy wood, adobe, tiles and other materials to build a house

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
У Инны есть свой небольшой магазин, где уже несколько лет она занимается торговлей кондитерскими изделиями. В ее семье все предприниматели - и муж и родители, поэтому и Инна всегда мечтала открыть свое дело.  Она очень серьезно относится к своему бизнесу и это замечают люди, поэтому в магазине нет недостатка в покупателях.

Инна старается, чтобы всегда был свежий товар и большой ассортимент сладостей на любой вкус. 
Ее магазин маленький, поэтому она искала возможность, чтобы расширить помещение. Недавно Инне повезло, ей предложили купить киоск рядом с ее магазином.  Такую возможность она не могла упустить, поэтому решила обратиться за кредитом. Полученные средства помогут Инне расширить свой магазин,тогда она еще увеличит количество товара. «Покупателям будет комфортнее, а значит и увеличится прибыль»-говорит Инна.
texts.en:
Inna owns a small store where she has been selling confections for several years now.  Her husband and parents, everyone in her family, are business people, and so Inna had always dreamed of having her own business.  She takes her business seriously and people notice that.  And it's because of this, that she always has customers in her store.

Inna always tries to have the freshest goods and a large assortment of sweets for any taste.  Because her store is small, she has been looking for an opportunity to expand it.  Recently, Inna had the good fortune to have an opportunity to buy the kiosk next to her store.  She couldn't let such a good opportunity get away, so she decided to apply for a loan.  The loan she receives will help her to expand her business and then she will increase the size of her inventory.  Inna says that her "customers will be better served which means that the profits will be better."

loans.use: to purchase a new larger facility for business

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru: У Натальи свой небольшой бизнес - она торгует одеждой и обувью на выездных рынках в Марганце, Софиевке и Никополе. Наталья не замужем, живет с двумя сыновяьми в своем доме, который требует ремонта. Наталья просит предоставить ней кредит, чтобы сделать напольное отопление в кухне, а также провести воду и канализацию в дом и установить ванную, умывальник и унитаз. Наталья - ответственная и пунктуальная. Она не боиться труда и хочет помочь своим детям начать самостоятельную взрослую жизнь.
texts.en: Natalia has her own small business.  She sells clothing and shoes at a market that travels between Mahranets, Sofiyivka, and Nikopol.  Natalia isn't married.  She and her two sons live in their own house but it is in need of work.  Natalia is requesting a loan in order to install in-floor heating in the kitchen and to hook up to the water and sewer lines so she can install a bathtub, sink, and toilet.  Natalia is a responsible and punctual woman.  She isn't afraid of work and wants to help her children begin their independent adult lives.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина продает вечерние платья в арендованном магазине. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже 22 года. У нее хороший вкус и много покупателей. Ирина хочет закупить новую коллекцию платьев на лето. Сейчас она может сделать закупки по выгодной цене, что поможет ей получить дополнительную прибыль.

Недавно у Ирины произошла кража. Украли часть ее товара с торговой точки. И хотя товар не нашли, Ирина не отчаилась. Она продолжала торговать и наращивать объем продаж, что помогло ей восстановитьс бизнес.

Ирина замужем, у нее с мужем трое взрослых детей, которые живут вместе с ними. Сейчас большую часть прибыли из бизнеса Ирина инвестирует обратно в бизнес. Ее мечта - куписть собственное помещение - небольшой магазинчик и увеличить объем продаж.
texts.en:
Irina sells dresses from her rented store.  She has been in this business for 22 years.  She has excellent taste and many customers.  Irina wants to buy a new collection of summer dresses.  She can make a purchase now, at an advantageous price, which will help her to earn extra profits.

Recently Irina's store was robbed.  They stole part of her inventory.  And while the clothes weren't found, Irina didn't lose hope.  She kept on selling and grew her sales figures.  This allowed her to get her business back on an even footing.

Irina is married and they have three adult children who live at home.  Currently Irina is investing the lion's share of her profit back into her business.  Her dream is to buy her own store, even if it is small, and to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase dresses for selling

loans.name: María Rocío

texts.es:
María se caracteriza por ser una mujer carismática, servicial y luchadora, es cabeza de hogar, razón por la que siempre busca alternativas que le permitan generar ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindar educación a sus hijas adolescentes.
Hace algunos años había iniciado su propio negocio, una tienda de video juegos y comidas, además su vivienda funcionaba como hogar del ICBF, en el que cuidaba a los niños, pero por los problemas de violencia que se presentaban en el sector, se vio obligada a trasladarse para otro barrio, cuidando de la vida propia y de sus hijas. Varios años después logró retornar a su antigua vivienda y con gran esfuerzo ha logrado reiniciar sus actividades pues abrió nuevamente el hogar ICBF y reinició su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas en la acera de la casa donde vive, con un carro de comidas que alquila para poder ejercer la labor y así generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de un carro de comidas e insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas), esto le permitirá aumentar el margen de rentabilidad pues se ahorrará el gasto del arriendo del carro y además tendrá disponibilidad suficiente de insumos para satisfacer la demanda actual y así mejorar los ingresos familiares. Así María verá como su sueño de tener un negocio consolidado se va haciendo realidad, pues es consciente que podrá tener la capacidad de seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijas y disfrutar una mejor calidad  de vida.
texts.en:
María is known as a charismatic, helpful, determined woman who is the head of household and always looking for ways to generate an income to support her family and provide an education for her adolescent daughters.

A few years ago she started her own video games and food business, and her home worked as an ICBF, caring for children.  But due to problems with violence in the sector she had to move to another neighborhood for her own safety and that of her daughters.  Several years later she was able to return to her previous home and through much effort has been able to resume her ICBF activities.  She returned to her fast food business outside her home with a food cart she rents so she can generate income to support the family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a food cart and wholesale supplies (breads, cold meats, sauces, sodas) which will allow her to earn more profit since she will not have to pay cart rental.  She will also have on the hand the supplies she needs to satisfy the current demand, which will increase her income.  In this way, María will reach her goal of having a consolidated business so she can continue supporting her daughters and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy food cart and wholesale supplies (breads, cold meats, sauces, sodas).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Reyna Altagracia

texts.es: Reyna de 48 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 16 años y 12 años de edad. Reyna posee una pequeña tienda en la cual comercializa ropa y variedad de bebidas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central de su localidad desde hace más de 8 años por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Reyna desea mejorar su negocio de tienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de bebidas, golosinas, ropa y de más artículos de  tienda que sean atractivos para los clientes.
texts.en:
Reyna, 48, lives in her own home with her two children, ages 16 and 12.  She has a small store where she sells clothing and a variety of beverages.  Her stand is set up in the central market of her town where she has been in business for eight years and has many customers who visit her daily.

Reyna wants to improve her business and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy beverages, sweets, clothing and other items to attract customers.

loans.use: To buy beverages, sweets, clothing and other articles to attract customers.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru: Ганна - наемный работник. Вот уже 2 года, как она работает продавцем на оптовом рынке. Ганне  21 год, она замужем, но детей пока еще нет. Ганна просит предоставить ей кредит для оборудования ванной комнаты - купить и положить кафельную плитку на пол и стены, а также купить и установить умывальник. Небольшая сумма в 5,000 гривен поможет семье Ганны существенно улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Ganna is a hired worker.  For two years now, she has been a sales woman at a wholesale market.  Ganna is 21 years old and married, but she doesn't yet have children.  Ganna is requesting a loan for equipping her bathroom.  She will buy and install tile on the floor and walls, as well as buy and install a sink.  5,000 hryven (UAH) isn't a large sum of money, but it will help Ganna and her family make a substantial improvement in their living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Melinda

texts.ru:
Мелинда замужем, есть двое детей. Вот уже 15 лет, как она заминамется выращиванием овощей в тепличных условиях. В основном выращивает огурец. Бизнес идет хорошо, большую часть прибыли Мелинда тратит на свою семью. 

В прошлом году сильный ветер порвал пленку на теплицах. Пропала часть урожая. Мелинда просит предоставить ей кредит для закупли пленки и мелкого ремонта теплиц.

Мелинда постоянно увеличивает площадь теплиц. Ее мечта - увеличить бизнес настолько, чтобы все члены ее семи могли быть задействованы. Тогда и работа для детей будет и прибыли будет гораздо больше.
texts.en:
Melinda is married and she has two children.  For 15 years now she has been in the business of growing vegetables in greenhouses.  She primarily grows peppers.  The business is going well and she spends the majority of her profits on her family.  

Last year there was a wind storm that tore the plastic covering on her greenhouses and she lost part of her harvest.  Melinda is requesting a loan to buy plastic covering and do some other small repairs.

Melinda is constantly increasing the size of her greenhouses.  Her dream is to expand her business enough that her entire family can be put to work.  Then there will even be work for the children and the profits will be a lot larger.

loans.use: to repair her green houses

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is forty-two years old and married with two children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
Melca is thirty-nine years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar and coffee to sell.

Melca has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Eireen

texts.en: Eireen is forty-five, married and has four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. She also runs a small variety store to earn additional income. Due to the high costs of school fees, she needs to increase her income to sustain their daily needs. She aims to improve her variety store but has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rufina works hard to support her family.

She has a bread vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from natural mat-making.  Rufina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell to the customers of her bread vending business.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening. Victoria is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and a son. She would like a loan to support her husband; he is a salesman and supplies goods to general stores. His daily practice is to carry inventories such as rusk, cakes, cookies, chocolates, etc., from wholesalers and deliver them to the retailers through bicycle transportation. 

A few years ago, he got into a road accident while he was driving his bike and one of his legs got fractured. Temporarily he was doing another job but he was earning a very low salary. 

Now, his injury has nearly recovered and he wants to start his grocery sales business again but he does not have cash in hand because most of his savings were spent on the injury.

Therefore, Shazia has requested a Kiva loan so that her husband can start his sales business again. She hopes that her husband will easily set up his business again and contribute to the household expenses, as he did earlier. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chocolate, biscuits and candies for her general store.

loans.name: Sanzen

texts.en:
Sanzen is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Sanzen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sanzen has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fertilized duck embryos.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es: José tiene 20 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida, suegra y cuñada. José y su familia poseen una pequeña panadería la cual con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado establecer y mantener desde hace más de 5 años. José desea hacer crecer su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: harina, huevos, mantequilla, colorantes, azúcar, etc. y así poder contar con una mayor capacidad para abarcar una mayor cuota de mercado y lograr su objetivo de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 20 years old and lives with his life partner, his mother-in-law and his sister-in-law. José and his family own a small bakery. With great effort and hard work they have managed to gain a good reputation and maintain it for more than five years.

José wants to expand his business, thinking of increasing his income and improving his and his family’s living conditions. He is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, butter, colorants and sugar. He will be able to attract more customers and reach his goal to increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, colorants, sugar and other ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs. 

Pompia is borrowing 35,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Wilma works hard to support her family. She has a sewing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. 

Wilma is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her sewing business, including thread, fabric and zippers. 

Wilma has sustained her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, including thread, fabric and zippers

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 9 años y su hija de 13 años de edad. Salvador es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y creativo quien busca las oportunidades del mercado para comercializar sus productos. Se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos de forma ambulante y aveces se actúa como payaso en los buses de su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica dado que no cuenta con el servio.
texts.en:
Salvador is 35 years old and lives in a house he owns with his life partner and their three children: two boys who are 11 and 9 years old and a 13 year old daughter.  Salvador is a hardworking, responsible, and creative man who looks for opportunities in the market to sell his products.  He works selling a variety of products as a traveling salesman.  He also sometimes acts as a clown on local buses.  This is how he supports his household and gives his family what they need.

With the goal of improving their living conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electricity, since he does not currently have it in his home.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is married and has two children who are both in school.  To help her husband meet their family needs, Jacqueline engaged herself in a retailing business while her husband manages their farm.  Jacqueline sells grocery items like snack foods, beverages and breads. 

She wanted to expand the products she sells but she can’t start on it because of insufficient funds.  In this connection, Jacqueline is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, shampoo and soaps.  She hopes to expand her business as soon as possible to be able to earn a larger income to pay her children's fees in school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es: José tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su suegra de 65 años de edad y su hijastro. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de minutas (postre preparado a base de hielo raspado, fruta y jarabes) y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y brinda lo necesario a su familia. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir dos paredes de ladrillo y encementar el piso del área interna de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en: José is 41 years old and lives in his own house together with his life partner, his 65-year-old mother-in-law and his stepchild. For the past 9 years, he has dedicated himself to selling minutas (a dessert made from shaved ice, fruit and syrup). In this way he supports his household and provides his family with the necessities. José is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he would like to build two brick walls and lay down cement on the floor of the living space in his home. With the amount he is requesting, he will buy cement, bricks, sand and iron bars.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron bars to build two walls and cover the floor of his home in cement.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 39 year old lady; she is the mother of a daughter and four sons.  Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides services to fix vans; he is very professional in his techniques and can easily fix engine problems in no time.  He has to use various types of tools for the maintenance of vehicles.  A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place.  

Due to the need to replace some of important and expensive tools such as Philips screw drivers, flat blade screw drivers, drill machines, pliers, sockets & ratchet set, heat gun, tri-square, G clamp, hammer etc. that were lost.  Therefore, Kosar has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to compensate against this loss by purchasing new tools and additional spare parts. 

Kosar wants to provide better education and living standards to her children.  She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income would increase.  Kosar gives thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools for repairing vans.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion is 62 years old and married with four children.

Purificacion works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  Purificacion has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Purificacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix junto a su esposa se dican a la elaboracion y venta de quesos el cual vende a las ferias de achacachi, Ademas trabaja como maestro albañil. vive en casa propia junto con sus tres hijos   en la comunidad chijipina, a dos horas y media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche.

El credito requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y asi, incrementara su produccion, y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Felix es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción de quesos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alongside his wife, Felix makes a living producing and selling cheese at the Achacachi fares. He also works as a builder. Felix lives in a house that he owns with his three children in the Cijipina community, two and a half hours from La Paz. Felix has only a few cattle which give him milk.

Felix needs this loan in order to buy a dairy cow and increase his production and income.

Felix's dream is to increase his number of cattle, thus increasing cheese production in his community..

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is always making plans for the future to achieve stability for his family.  Currently he works for a private company, and his wife sells clothes to help her husband support the household.  Roberto is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to make improvements to his farm business.  Roberto is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business

loans.name: Jairo Santiago

texts.es:
Jairo, manifiesta que la experiencia que tuvo al invertir el crédito anterior ha sido satisfactoria ya que compro materia prima para elaborar el menú que ofrece en su comedor, en la actualidad cuenta con más clientes satisfechos, mejores ventas y sus ingresos han aumentado lo que le facilita cumplir con sus compromisos económicos y familiares.
Para surtir nuevamente su inventario está solicitando más capital para comprar cebollas, arroz, aceite, tomates, condimentos, carnes, embutidos, bebidas, etc. de esta manera su negocio se mantendrá activo y sus clientes no preferirán la competencia.
texts.en:
Jairo tells us that his last experience investing his loan was satisfactory as he was able to buy basic supplies for preparing the foods available on the menu at his restaurant. Jairo now has more satisfied customers, higher sales, and his income has increased, helping him to fulfill his financial commitments, and his commitments to his family 

In order to re-stock his business, Jairo is applying for more capital to buy onions, rice, oil, tomatoes, sauces, meat, cold meats, drinks and more. With these items, his business will remain active and his customers will not go to his competition-

loans.use: to buy onions, rice, oil, tomatoes, sauces, meat, cold meats, drinks and more.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family.  Marilou is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.  Marilou has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts and pig feed.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 28-year-old married woman, and she has three children.  She is living in a populated area, she knows about the requirements of people in this area.  Her husband is a market vendor and sells washing machines in his nearby community.  He knows customers' needs and has reliable suppliers.  He purchases washing machines from wholesalers and sells to the cooperative stores. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income.  He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he could maximize heis sales and could get maximum reward against his efforts.  But insufficient cash in hand is a major problem for him.

Therefore, Sidra has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy additional washing machines for supplying to the cooperative stores.  In this way he would be able to buy generate additional income for his family and could cherish his children.

loans.use: To buy washing machines for resale.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a thirty-four-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She belongs to a poor family, which lives from hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop where he sells ladies and gent’s clothes. He has been running this business for many years so that he can provide for his whole family. Unfortunately he could not build up a good relationship among his customers, so he could not establish his enterprise. Now with an increase in household expenses, he considers it necessary to grow the business also. But the lack of capital is a major problem.
  
Therefore, Fozia took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothes to sell. Fozia thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zhara

texts.fr: ZHARA est une femme veuve de 47ans qui est mère de 4 enfants dons le plus grand a 22 ans et le plus petit 10ans. Sachant qu’elle n’a pas de soutient, elle est restauratrice de profession et elle voudrait se lancer dans le commerce des tissus et de produits cosmétiques. Elle gère les charges et dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans son activité et commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 500.000F diversifier son activité en achetant des produits cosmétiques et des tissus afin de satisfaire ses commandes. A l’avenir elle voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution augmenter ses revenus en diversifiant ses articles et devenir pérenne dans ses activité ainsi elle pourra construire sa maison et mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Zhara is a 47-year-old widow who has four children, the eldest is 22 years old and the youngest is ten years old.  She is a restaurant owner by profession, but, knowing that she has no-one to rely on apart from herself, she would like to expand into selling fabric and cosmetic products.  She provides for all the expenses of her family by working from six in the morning until six in the evening.  Zhara has more than five years' experience in her business.

She has requested this loan of 500,000 francs CFA, in order to diversify her business, and buy cosmetic products and fabric to fulfil various orders.

In the future, Zhara would like to continue working with the field partner to further diversify the range of products she offers and increase her income.  She hopes to make her business more stable so that she can build a house and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Mary Grace now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mary Grace has taken out a 10,000 Philippine peso housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Mary Grace is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est majoritairement composé de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Missira I  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de pâte d’arachide, bazin et encens. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pâtes d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs d’arachides à Bamako. Pour faire des pâtes, elle grille les grains dans une barrique constituée pour la cause, les épluche et les trie avant de les broyer au moulin. La revente se fait en détail à Missira I à une clientèle mixte. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille surtout les enfants dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Most of the women in the Benkadi Group are polygamous.  They are, on average, forty-one years old, and have four children.  They all live in Missira I, and know one another because they live in the same neighbourhood.  The women sell peanut paste, damask fabric and incense.  In order to help them to build up their stock levels, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Ami (sitting on the far left of the photo) is well-known for selling peanut paste.  She will use her loan to buy six sacks of peanuts in Bamako.  To make the paste, she roasts the peanuts in a specially designed barrel, then she removes the skins, sorts them and grinds them in a mill.

Ami sells the paste in Missira I, to various customers.  She hopes to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business.

Ami would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to provide for the needs of her family, especially the children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est majoritairement composé de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Missira1 et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, vêtement (pagnes wax, bazins), condiments, produits cosmétiques et charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Goundo (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, bazins). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax, 10mètres de bazins au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Missira1 et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Goundo espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya Group are polygamous.  They are, on average, forty-eight years old, and have three children.  They all live in Missira I, and know one another because they live in the same neighbourhood.  The women sell clothing (wax pagnes - traditional wrap-around clothing, and damask fabric), food ingredients, cosmetic products and charcoal.

In order to increase their working capital, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their third loan.

Goundo (sitting on the far left of the photo) is well-known for selling clothing (wax pagnes and damask fabric).  She will use her loan to buy twenty wax pagnes and ten metres of damask fabric at the main market.  She sells her products on foot in Missira I, to various customers.  Goundo hopes to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

Goundo would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso until she is able to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is thirty five years old and has five children. Lorna is married and three of her children are in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lorna is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Lorna can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a clothing business; his practice is to buy uniforms from a wholesaler and sell them from his shop. He has many contacts with the various schools; their students like to buy uniforms from his shop.

Nowadays, a new badge has started in schools, and the demand for uniforms has increased, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy more uniforms. Therefore, Shafqat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more uniforms to fulfill the demand.

She is in a repeated loan cycle and has been showing excellent repayment behavior; she has already been taking the loans from BRAC and investing in the business. Her dreams are for the bright future of her children, the establishment of the business and better living standards for her family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms for resale.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe .Kankélé est  majoritairement composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Missira I et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de, condiments (oignons, échalotes, choux, tomates, aubergines, persils…), produits cosmétiques et de la restauration. Dans l’intention de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Anna (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons, échalotes…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400kg d’oignons et une tonne d’échalotes à Bamako avec les forains de Niono. La revente se fait en détail au marché  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Anna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The women of the Kankélé Group are polygamous.  They are, on average, forty-four years old, and have six children.  They all live in Missira I, and know one another because they live in the same neighbourhood.  The women sell food ingredients (onions, shallots, cabbages, tomatoes, aubergines, parsley, etc), cosmetic products and run restaurants.  In order to be able to build up their stock levels, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third loan.

Anna (standing on the far left of the photo) is well-known for selling food ingredients (onions, shallots, etc).  She will use her loan to buy 400 kgs of onions and one tonne of shallots in Bamako, at the Niono fairs.  She will then sell her products to various customers at the market.

Anna hopes to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

She, and the other members of the group, would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso until they can afford to buy a plots of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 42. She is married and was gifted with three children attending school. They are currently residing in a village and make their living through farming. She also runs a small variety store to have an additional source of income. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to increase their income in order to support the education of their children. She aims to increase the stock in her store, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps, seasonings, rice, soft drinks and load wallet to resell. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps, seasonings, rice, soft drinks and load wallet to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vergie is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Vergie's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Vergie is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Vergie has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Vergie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house after hers was destroyed by the typhoon

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 61 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alberta has a native mat weaving business in the Philippines. Alberta requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Alberta has been in this business for 10 years. Alberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell soft drinks business in the Philippines.

Cristina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more chicks for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy brinda sus servicios en la elaboracion de camperas con máquina de coser,
moldes, reglas, tijeras, agujas, cinta métrica, pesas, tizas de colores,etc., con un cacabado fino y de gran calidad.

El vive en casa  propia ubicado en La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar telas 

El sueño de Freddy es combertir su negocio en un taller de renombre con maquinas ya actualizadas, pues asi mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Freddy offers his services in jacket making with a sewing machine, moulds, rulers, scissors, needles, measuring tape, pattern weights,  coloured chalk etc… with a smooth finish and high quality.

He lives in his own house located in La Paz. He needs a loan to purchase fabrics.

Freddy’s dream is to turn his business into a renowned workshop with up-dated machines therefore increasing his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for his clothing business.

loans.name: Dénise  Germaine

texts.fr: Denise est une femme de 41 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 1 et 20 ans. trois de ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert un bar qu'elle gère elle même dans un quartier de la place depuis 10 ans. Ce bar l'aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son chaleureux accueil et ses bonnes relations avec le voisinage. Elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui accroit au fil du temps et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour les besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Denise is a 41-year-old, married woman with four children between the ages of one and twenty years.  Three of her children currently attend school.  

She has been running a bar in a local area for ten years now, which allows her to contribute towards the needs of her family.  Her business is successful thanks to her warm, welcoming attitude and her good relationship with her neighbours.  She has built up a good and loyal clientele which increases by the day, unfortunately she is unable to satisfy this growing demand due to a lack of capital.  This is why she has requested a loan.  The loan will enable her to please her customers, increase her sales and therefore increase her profit margin.  She will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and provide for the day-to-day needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married mother of four school-aged children. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

Selina sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She says that seasonality is her major challenge.

She joined Yehu to boost her business, and with the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr: Gisele est une jeune femme de 36 ans,mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 à 7 ans. deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école.Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 7 ans et tient également une petite échoppe dans laquelle elle vend du savon,du cube,du sucre,du sel et bien d'autres.Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui lui permettra de réinvestir dans sa petite échoppe afin de l'agrandir,mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gisele is a young woman of 36 years, married and the mother of 3 children between the ages of 1 and 7. Two of her children already attend school. Gisele has run a small call box in a neighborhood of the capital for 7 years and also owns a small stall from which she sells soap, stock cubes, sugar, salt, and other items. 

Gisele buys calling credit from the telecom operators twice a week, on average. However, the demand for calls and credit is steadily increasing, and she is having problems fulfilling her customers' demands as her capital does not allow her to restock properly, which produces constant inventory problems and is causing her the gradual loss of her customers. 

Gisele is requesting this loan so that she can get more calling credit which will enable her to retain and grow her customer base and, consequently, her profits. These profits will allow her to reinvest in her small stall in order to grow the business, and also to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy calling credit.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. 

For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Due to the ugly-looking vehicle, he is unable to attract passengers and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy the rickshaw body as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of availability of funds; he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. 

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Raissa

texts.en:
Raissa is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with her family. She is the mother of three children, and all of them go to school. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He raises cattle in his yard at home and sells them at a local market. He has to feed the sheep, goats, calves and heifers till one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure.
 
He wants to buy more cattle for increasing the herd and keeping constant the breeding procedure but he has already invested his all savings into his current cattle farm.
 
Therefore, Raissa has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy bull calves and a heifer for cattle farming. 

Fetal diseases are the major challenges for him. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit amount he will buy fodder for cattle and medicine to fight diseases.

Raissa is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sheep, goats, a heifer and a bull calf for cattle farming.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine se dedica a la venta de shamphoo SELFI y BELLA de buena calidad y al gusto del cliente.

Ella vive en casa de su hermano ubicado en La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar mayor cantidad de shampoos para incrementar sus ventas en el negocio de productos de belleza 

El sueño de Catherine es abrir una su propia distrubuidora de cosmeticos. en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Catherine makes a living selling SELFI and BELLA shampoos which are good quality and suit her customers' taste.

She lives in her brother's house in La Paz. She needs the loan to buy a larger quantity of shampoo so she can increase her sales in her beauty products business.

Catherine's dream is to set herself up as a cosmetics distributer from her own home.

loans.use: to buy shampoo for her business selling beauty products.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 60 years old, widowed and has only one child. They live in a rural community where she has run a small variety store for almost 10 years. Due to hardships of living, she aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. 

She plans to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to acquire more stocks of grocery items and fertilizers to resell in the local community. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to make the business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of grocery items and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from videoke machine rental and selling purified drinking water.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Siongiroi area of South Rift, Kenya with his wife and five children, some of whom are still in school. 

He has been farming for 12 years, with his income coming from the sale of milk, eggs, and mixed crops. In farming, he enjoys feeding the animals the most.

John chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, he learned that MFIs do assist low income earners to economically grow by advising them on the projects they can undertake and by giving them financial support to start off.

This loan will enable John to construct a greenhouse where his crops will do very well and he will bring in more income and increased profit. He will take care of his family well and will cater to his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a greenhouse.

loans.name: Khadijah

texts.en:
Khadijah appreciates Kiva lenders for their continued support towards helping her financially thus enabling her to boost her business.

Khadijah is asking for a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop  business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with six children, three of whom go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kerosene-selling business for the past four years.She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Eduardo Isai

texts.es:
Eduardo, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para surtir su venta de ropa con prendas que estén de moda y diversificadas en estilos, colores, tallas para ambos sexos, comprara blusas, camisetas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos y trajes, con estos sus clientes continuaran teniendo un buen servicio.
El capital que se le otorgo anteriormente lo utilizo para comprar ropa para la temporada navideña con la que aumento su número de clientes, sus ventas son mejores y los ingresos son mayores, han sido de mucha ayuda porque él cancelo sus deudas y ha mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is requesting a new loan to stock his clothing store with garments that are in fashion and diverse in style, colour, and size for both sexes. He will buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, dresses and suits; with these his clients will continue to have good service.

The capital he was previously given he used to buy clothing for the Christmas season which increased his client base. His sales and revenue are higher. It has been a big help because he paid off his debt and has improved his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, dresses and suits.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica a la elaboracion de deportivos, diseñada para ser ligera y para permitir que el sudor se evapore rápidamente de la piel durante el ejercicio. La ropa deportiva con funciones de refrigeración puede estar hecha de fibras sintéticas, tales como el polipropileno, o fibras naturales como la lana. El diseño de la ropa, incluyendo el ajuste, el tejido y el color, también influyen en la capacidad del material para mantenerse fresco durante los entrenamientos.

Ella vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar una maquina de cocer 

El sueño de Juana junto a su esposo exportar las prendas deportivas en un futuro a nivel nacional,con la marca Boliviana pues asi mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana has a business selling sports clothes that are designed to be lightweight and enable sweat to evaporate quickly from the skin during exercise.  This sportswear has cooling properties, and is made from synthetic fibers such as polypropylene or natural fibers such as wool.  The design of the clothing, including the fit, fabric and color, also affects the ability of the garments to keep you cool during workouts.

Juana lives in the city of La Paz.  She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine.  

Juana's dream is that she and her husband will someday export the sports clothes at the national level with the brand "Boliviana."  This would increase their income and their family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is forty years old and married with ten children, one of whom is in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Judith has restarted her rice retailing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Judith has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Judith is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is taking a loan to buy stocks of sequins, pearls and gum for pasting over shawls to sell to the retailers. She has been pasting sequins over shawls for many years and thus feeding her children. She is a responsible mother; she knows very well about her duties and responsibilities regarding her family members. She always keeps busy and ready to provide better facilitates to her children.

She is 43 and the mother of six children. Her husband does work in a small firm at very low daily wages and comes home very late at night. With inflation and rapid increases in household expenses, she wants to buy buy stocks of sequins, pearls and gum for pasting over shawl on daily basis. Due to financial constraints she finds it difficult to buy the materials.
 
Therefore, Nusrat has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so she can buy stocks of sequins, pearls and gum.

Nusrat is very happy and relaxed after receiving this loan because this loan will enable her to increase her monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy stocks of sequins, pearls and gum for pasting over shawls.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en casa propia ya que pudo adquirirla con sus esfuersos propios juento a su familia, se encuentra ubicada enla ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel Secundario. Trabaja como chofer propietario en el Sindicato mixto de choferes 29 de Mayo. 
El crédito lo requiere para la terminacion de construccion de sus murallas de divicion de la parte del terreno que le corresponde que adquirieron junto a sus familiares.
El sueño de Juan, es poder mejorar su hogar poco a poco, tiene la idea a futuro poder construir en su terreno una tienda para su esposa y asi poder generar mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working person. He lives in his own house which he was able to buy jointly with his family through his own hard work. It is situated in the city of El Alto. Juan only studied as far as Secondary level and works as an owner-driver in the '29 de Mayo' joint drivers' Union.

Juan needs the loan to finish building the dividing walls for his share of the land which he acquired with other family members.

Juan's dream is to be able to gradually improve his home. An idea he has for the future is to build a shop for his wife on the land so they can have a better income and improve their own and their family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish building dividing walls on his land.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel, un campesino de 48 años de edad, se caracteriza por su tenacidad, pujanza y don de gentes, es casado y padre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Nació en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en las labores del campo una alternativa de vida, tareas que han pasado como herencia de generación en generación; gracias a eso, desde hace 17 años se dedica a la producción de leche, pues tiene varias cabezas de ganado vacuno que le producen alrededor de 700 litros semanales, este líquido es vendido a una empresa de lácteos reconocida a nivel nacional; de manera alterna y con el fin de complementar los ingresos, también trabaja como mayordomo de una finca de la región, esto le permite brindar a su familia alimento diario.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de 2 vacas productoras de leche, esto le permitirá aumentar la producción y mejorar las utilidades por la venta del líquido blanco.
Miguel expresa su amor y pasión por la labor que realiza, por ello sueña con tener la capacidad de aumentar su producción y garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable, para disfrutar junto a ellos de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 48 year-old farmer who is known for his tenacity, vigor, and people skills.  He is married and is the father of 2 children, whom he has raised with great effort and dedication.

Miguel was born into a poor family that supported itself with farm work.  Knowledge of farming has been passed down as an inheritance from generation to generation in his family.  Thanks to this, he has 17 years of experience in producing milk.  He has a number of heads of dairy cattle that produce about 700 liters of milk a week.  He sells the milk to a dairy company that is known at the national level.  In addition, in order to supplement his income, he works as a supervisor on a farm in the region.  This enables him to provide for his family's daily needs.  

Miguel is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of 2 dairy cows.  This will allow him to increase his production and improve his profits from his milk sales.  

Miguel expresses his love and passion for the work that he does.  He dreams of being able to increase his production and guarantee his family's financial stability.  This way, they could all enjoy better living conditions and a better life.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 43 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Gemma has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Gemma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she coan afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es una persona muy trabajadora, vive junto a sus abuelos juanto a su padres de familia en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel Secundario. Trabaja como costurero es propietario de dos maquinas de coser una Recta y una Overlock. 
Necesita crédito para comprar tela e hilos ya que el solo cobraba la nano de obra de la costura de elaboracion de chalequitos para cachorros y ahora el desea ser el directo productor de dicho producto.
Gerardo quiere mejorar su actividad a futuro con la compra de maquinaria mejorada y mas material para producir variedad de prendas de vestiry asi mejorar sus ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a very hard-working person.  He lives with his grandparents and his parents in the city of El Alto.
He only went to school through high school.  He works as a tailor.  He has two sewing machines, a straight-stitch and an overlock.

He needs the loan to buy fabric and thread.  He used to only charge for the labor for making clothing for dogs.  Now he wishes to be the direct producer of the clothing.

Gerardo wants to improve his business activity in the future.  He will do so by purchasing better machinery and more material to produce a variety of garments.  This way he will improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for his clothing business.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar manages a small store in their village. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. She has been in her business for over 10 years and wants to keep improving her sales to save funds for her family in times of  emergencies. So, she is asking for a loan of P4,000 to buy sardines, noodles, eggs and soap to sell. This will help increase capacity of sales and income. She hopes to continuously sell good yet affordable merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, eggs and soap to sell

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 26 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  

Ethel and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Ethel is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ethel has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Ethel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para estos, con este negocio produce los ingresos necesarios para dar a  su familia un estilo de vida digno, su horario de atención a los clientes es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., ella es madre soltera y solo lleva la responsabilidad de criar a sus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad.
Con el fin de mejorar el inventario y brindar mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de celulares, manos libres, cargadores, estuches, etc., con lo que espera mejorar su clientela y  obtener mayor rentabilidad.
Aspira tener una mejor economía para continuar renovando la mercadería, hacer mejoras en la infraestructura de su local y sobre todo cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Johana makes a living selling mobile phones and accessories. With this business she makes enough income to give her family a decent lifestyle. She serves customers from 8am to 5pm. She is a single mother and has the sole responsibility for bringing up her two children aged 8 and 10. 

In order to improve her range of stock and give her customers more choice, Johana is asking for a loan so she can buy mobile phones, hands-free kits, chargers, covers etc. She hopes this will help her to increase her clientele and give her better profits. She aims to improve her finances so she can continue to update the stock, make improvements to the infrastructure of her premises and above all change the family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, hands-free kits, chargers, covers etc.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 52 years old and married with five children.

Ester works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Ester has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from an internet café and room rental.

Ester aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mirasol Joefel

texts.en:
Mirasol Joefel is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mirasol Joefel is thirty-two years old and has three children who are in school.

Mirasol Joefel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her rice retailing and is committed to regain what she lost. Mirasol Joefel is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mirasol Joefel has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mirasol Joefel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories, doors and windows, which are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding tools became out of order due to overheating and needed to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new welding tools but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses.
 
Therefore, Fareeda has requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant and iron goods for manufacturing accessories.
  
Fareeda thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding tools and goods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Sara Marisol

texts.es:
Sara, se dedica a tender su tienda de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, con esta actividad obtiene los recursos económicos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, Sara es madre soltera de una niña de 12 años de edad, no posee ayuda del extranjero.
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar golosinas, sal, azúcar, bebidas, arroz, papel higiénico, etc., así ofrecerá mercadería solicitada por sus clientes, espera mejorar sus ventas y continuar teniendo buenas ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más rentable para dar a su familia mejores oportunidades de superación académica y mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Sara tends her store from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  In her store she sells basic needs items.  Through this business activity she gets the financial resources needed to cover the family expenses.  Sara is the single mother of a 12 year old girl.  She does not get help from abroad.

She will use the loan to buy candy, salt, sugar, drinks, and toilet paper, etc.  This way she will offer merchandise that is requested by her customers.  She hopes to improve her sales and to continue having good profits.

Her dream is to have a more profitable business in order to give her family better opportunities for academic improvement and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy candy, salt, sugar, drinks, and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Michael, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children who are still at school.  He has been running a  photography business for eight years now.  He works from 7 am to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Michael's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy small items in the photography business and bought a motorcycle.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy a good camera.  He dreams of building his own house. 

Michael will share this loan with his loan group "Apple" which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good camera.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru:
Мижгона предприимчивая юная девушка в возрасте 20 лет живет в районе Мастчох города Худжанд со своими родителями. Ее отец работает электриком, а мать домохозяйка. Мижгона на протяжении 4 лет работала вместе с родственниками в сфере торговли. Она полностью изучила все нюансы торгового бизнеса, набралась достаточного опыта и теперь хочет заняться этим делом самостоятельно. 
Мижгона рядом с центральной больницей уже приобрела помещение и собирается открыть там свой магазин. Она планирует заняться продажей домашней женской одежды и одежды для новорожденных. Для привоза товара Мижгоне не хватает 2000 долларов США. В связи с этим она запрашивает кредит. Мижгона с надеждой и верой ждет поддержки. Кредит поможет ей самоутвердиться и осуществить ее давнюю мечту - она будет заниматься собственным бизнесом и сможет улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en:
Mijgona is an enterprising young woman from the Mastchokh district of Khujand. She is 20 years old and lives with her parents. Her father is an electrician and her mother is a homemaker. Mijgona has worked in retail with her relatives for four years. She has learned all the intricacies of the trade and now wants to start her own business.

Mijgona has acquired a storefront near the central hospital and is planning to open her own shop selling clothing for women and infants.
