She does not have the $2000 necessary for clothing imports so she is requesting a loan in the hope of support. The loan will help her to assert her independence and realize her dream of having her own business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women and infants in order to open a store and start a new business

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loreta is 59 years old and has three children who are in school.

Loreta has a buy-and-sell sand business in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of sand to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for five years. Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sand to sell

loans.name: Nehemías Esaú

texts.es:
Nehemías tiene 24 años de edad, está acompañado y solo tiene una hija de 1 año, estudió hasta segundo año de bachillerato y actualmente vive con su madre y hermanos.
Él tiene un negocio de pupusas desde hace 2 años y lo aprendió con un amigo, tiempo después su amigo le dejó el negocio para que él lo atendiera.

El crédito que está solicitando, lo necesita para invertir en su negocio, pues desea mejorarlo y tener el local mas equipado, comprará sillas y mesas, esto le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que obtendrá mas ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia. 

Nehemías sueña con surtir mas el negocio, contratar mas personal para darles buena atención a los clientes y las ganancias la utilizará para seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Nehemías, who is 24 years old, has a partner and just one daughter, who is one year old. He studied as far as second year of high school and currently lives with his mother and siblings. For the last 2 years he has had a business selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. He learnt this business from a friend and some time afterwards his friend left him the business to look after.

Nehemías is asking for the loan as he needs it to invest in the business, since he wants to improve it and fit his premises out better by buying tables and chairs. This will enable him to improve his quality of life as it will provide him with better profits so he can bring his family up. 

Nehemías dreams of stocking the business better and hiring more staff to provide his customers with a good service. He will use the profits to continue investing.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his business selling pupusas.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 51-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. Despite hardships, he has the determination to uplift their standard of living. He aims to improve his farming business in order to generate sufficient income. He plans to acquire more pigs to raise but he has not enough capital.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP19,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. He is hoping that someday, he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Lovino

texts.en:
Lovino is married and lives with his wife and kids. Lovino is involved in farming. He cultivates rice. Lovino takes care of the farm with great love and care and does his best to gather a good harvest. Now, by applying for this loan, Lovino is asking  lenders to support him with the farm.

Lovino plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will be a huge support for his farm and he hopes for lenders' support. Lovino is a very loving father. He hopes that he can achieve his dreams for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia actualmente esta separada de su pareja. vive en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos. Amalia se dedica a la venta de comidas Ella  vive en La Paz. Necesita credito para terminar la construccion de su casa (acabado de obra fina) como se ve en la foto enviada con estos datos.

El sueño de Amalia es contar con un domicilio en condiciones de buena habitabilidad para confort de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amalia is separated from her spouse at present. She lives in La Paz in her own house with her two children. Amalia sells meals.

Amalia needs a loan to complete the construction of her house, especially finishing work, as can be seen in the photo sent with her application.

Amalia's dream is to have a home in good habitable condition for the comfort of her children.

loans.use: to finish construction of her home (seen in the photo).

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is separated and has a direct-selling business, selling Natasha products in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of Natasha products to sell, like shoes, body spray, sandals, and blouses.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Natasha products to sell, like shoes, body spray, sandals, and blouses.

loans.name: Lelit

texts.en:
Lelit is 20 years old and single, with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lelit's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lelit has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lelitis  has committed to rebuild her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. Juanita is married and has a chainsaw rental business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business.  She has been in this business for 16 years now. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila  is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past seven years; he is the only person responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Naila's husband wants to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes, but due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products to resell. Therefore Naila has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these goods and will also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Naila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, ella está casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante de un centro penal, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están estudiando y una hija ya trabaja por lo tanto solo 2 dependen de ella.

María se dedica a la venta de sopa de res, los hace los dias lunes y jueves de cada semana, y los otros dias hace ventas de diferentes tipos, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio pues es una mujer trabajadora. 

Ella está solicitando este crédito, para comprar ollas para cocinar las sopas que elabora, pues las que tiene ya no le sirven y no ha estado vendiendo lo suficiente, es por eso que a María le urge comprar más ollas para continuar con su trabajo y que no le falten los ingresos económicos.

Ella sueña con que su negocio vaya creciendo, para obtener ganancias con las cuales pueda seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 38, went to school through the third grade.  She is married, and her husband works as a guard at a prison.  She has three children; two of them go to school.  A daughter is working, so only two of her children are dependent upon her.

María sells beef soup.  She makes it on Monday and Thursday every week.  The other days she sells different kinds.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is a hard-working woman.

She is requesting this loan to buy pots to cook the soups that she makes.  The ones that she has are no longer serviceable, and she has not been selling enough.  That is why María plans to buy more pots in order to continue with her work and not miss the income.

She dreams of her business growing in order to get profits that she can use to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy pots to cook the soups that she makes.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es: El G.S. Milagro de Dios esta conformado por cuatro integrantes: Norma Elena, Neftali del Carmen, Juan Alberto y Alma Nubia, todos mayores de edad originarios de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país,todos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, honrados, y responsables en su formas de pago, estos integrantes se conoce muy bien debido que pertenecen a la misma zona, por lo que optan por formar un Grupos Solidario para ayudarse mutuamente uno a otros económicamente e invertir en sus distintos negocios,  el cual consiste en la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros al igual que un taller de ebanistería como: camas, ropero, cómodas, cunas, puertas entre otros. Norma quien es la coordinadora del grupo solidario es la encargada por el cumplimiento de los pagos en tiempo y forma de cada uno de ellos, Norma, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para dama, caballero y niños, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, juego de sabanas, trajesitos de niño entre otros, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante empezando su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para lograr brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes, el Objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo para invertir en sus negocios, como: uniformes, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, El G.S. Milagro de Dios esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
The "Milagro de Dios" communal bank is made up of four members: Norma Elena, Neftali del Carmen, Juan Alberto and Alma Nubia. They are all adults from one of the towns in Chinandega, in the west of the country. They are all hard-working, trustworthy and responsible with their payments. The members know each other very well since they come from the same area. This is why they decided to form a communal bank to help each other out economically and invest in their different businesses. These include buying and selling general merchandise such as various styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics and other items as well as a furniture workshop producing beds, wardrobes, chest of drawers, cots, doors and other items.

Norma, who is the leader of the communal bank, is responsible for making sure everyone pays the correct amount at the right time. She is a micro businesswoman who makes a living selling general merchandise such as various styles of clothing for men, women and children, shoes, cosmetics, plastic items, bedlinen sets and little suits for boys. She sells these as a street vendor, starting her working day very early so she can provide a better service to her customers.

The purpose of this loan is to have working capital to invest in the businesses, by buying items such as uniforms, cosmetics and plastic items.

The "Milagro de Dios" communal bank is very grateful for the support which the Kiva lenders offer to people of limited resources.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, wood and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, esta madre soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, actualmente vive en la casa de su madre ocupando una habitación pequeña, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día prestando servicios como contadora en entidades privadas y también realiza trabajos independientes los fines de semana, y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su hijito.
El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de un equipo de computación mas completo y actualizado para poder facilitar su trabajo, ya que de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de María, es poder independizarse profesionalmente para brindarle mas comodidad y seguridad a su hijo, de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother with a small son. At present, she lives in a small area in her mother's house, located in the city of La Paz.

At present, she works more than 8 hours a day as an accountant in private businesses and, also, she works independently on weekends. With her current income she manages to cover the costs of food and basic services for her little son.

Maria intends to invest the loan in the purchase of a more complete and up to date computer to facilitate her work. In this way, she will be able to improve her income.

Maria's dream is to become professionally independent and offer more comfort and security to her son, and in this manner, to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer for use in her accounting services business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Gul Bano

texts.en:
Gul Bano is a 45-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing iron wire coils through melting cast iron. He buys iron scrap material from factories and puts it into high temperatures for melting and then reshaping. Wire is often reduced to the desired diameter and properties by repeated drawing through progressively smaller dies, or, traditionally, holes in draw plates. After a number of passes the wire may be annealed to facilitate more drawing or, if it is a finished product, to maximize ductility and conductivity.

Gul Bano has four children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn sufficient income to support her family well. She is in her fifth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy cast iron for manufacturing so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.
Gul Bano is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cast iron for making iron wire.

loans.name: Glenis

texts.en:
Glenis is 22 years old and single.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenis requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Glenis has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glenis would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatheya

texts.en:
Fatheya is a Palestinian women from Gaza Strip. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother of three children.

She chose to take a loan from the Arab Center for Agricultural Development (ACAD) to improve the standard of her living by using the money to develop her business. She started her business where she lives, in her own house. 

In the future, Fatheya is looking to expand and develop her business and to increase the number of birds. Concerning challenges, there are none. Finally, Fatheya wants to thank ACAD and Kiva for letting her share the story.

loans.use: to buy more birds and pigeons to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean and healthy cooking gas package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Liquefied Petroleum Gas package so that she can prepare food quickly and efficiently

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita se dedica a la cocina desde la preparacion higienicamente y con alimentos saludables para digerir con calidad optima hasta que llegue la variedad de platos a su mesa, presentación final de un plato con alimentos de buena calidad y al gusto del cliente.ella tambien obrece sus servicios para matrimonios, bautizos en si todo tipo de acontecimientos.

Ella vive en alquiler ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar provisiones en mayor cantidad para su negocio de alimentos, para empezar ella quiere comprar más carne y papas  

El sueño de Margarita es abrir una pension de renombre e incluso llevar a pedidos los clientes.
texts.en: Margarita works in her kitchen hygienically preparing a variety of food with easily digestible healthy ingredients resulting in a final presentation of plates with ingredients of high quality to the customer's taste. She also offers her services for weddings, baptisms, and every type of event. She lives in a rental located in the city of La Paz. She needs the loan to buy supplies at wholesale for her catering business, and to begin she wants to buy more meat and potatoes. Margarita's dream is to open a renowned hostel and even take orders to the clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale like meat and potatoes for her catering business.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 35 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Maria Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Lourdes' business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Maria Lourdes has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maria Lourdes has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maria Lourdes is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to repair and renovate her family home and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marnelli

texts.en:
Marnelli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Marnelli earns more income from a general store.

Marnelli is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her dress making business. Marnelli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to the ultra poor family group and has been barely feeding his children.
Babra has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but, at the time of purchase, some money was still needed.  Therefore, Babra has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that, now that her husband does not have any need to pay the daily fare, there should be an increase in income.  Babra is a 40-year old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She hopes that her husband will be able to have more income because now he will not pay a daily fare to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan.  She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan..

loans.use: To buy auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas in order for him to save and buy enough food for the family

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es:
Lurdes,es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la población de Palomar en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas al día dedicándose por completo al cultivo de hortalizas,ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le facilita en la producción de hortalizas por que no necesita mucho riego y el tiempo de producción es mas rápido.
El sueño de Lurdes es aumentar sus hectáreas de producción con la finalidad de independizarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lurdes is single and does not have children.  She lives in Palomar, in her parents' home.  She takes up only one bedroom that has brick walls and a dirt floor.  Currently, she works over 10 hours a day growing vegetables.  With her earnings, she must pay for her food and basic needs.  

She will use the loan to purchase modified seeds that will help her vegetable production as they do not need much water and they grow more quickly.  Lurdes's dream is to increase her planting area and eventually become independent and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase modified seeds for her business.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido es  soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación de ladrillo con pisos de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de Palomar.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de doce horas al día dedicándose por completo al cultivo de hortalizas y con los ingresos que tiene cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que desea facilitar su trabajo por que la producción es en menor tiempo y no necesita de mucho riego.
El sueño de Guido, es mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y tener sus propias hectáreas para su producción esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Guido is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents' home, taking up only one bedroom that has brick walls and a dirt floor.  The house is located in Palomar.  He currently works over 12 hours a day growing vegetables.  With her earnings, he pays for his food and basic needs.  

He will use the loan to purchase modified seeds as he wishes to make his work easier because the harvesting time would be quicker and would require less water.

Guido's dream is to improve his income in order to become independent and have his own land to farm on and in so doing, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase modified seeds.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family.
Nasreen's husband needs to improve the maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance work on his taxi. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. He will provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nasreen  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.  Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make expanse on her husband's Taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Mercedesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mercedesa works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mercedesa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to  buy additional boxes of fish for her fish vending business.

Mercedesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is thirty-five years old and has three children. Letecia is married and has one child who is in school.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Letecia is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000  to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Letecia has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.   She plans to recover through her rice retailing.

With your help, Letecia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In future,she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la población de Palomar en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día dedicándose a la producción de hortalizas y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le ayuda por que no necesita de mucho riego y la producción es mas rápida.
El sueño de Rodrigo es comprarse un tractor para facilitar su trabajo ya que es muy agotador trabajando todo el día y a veces soportando el frio o mucho sol, de esta forma también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single and does not have children.  He lives in Palomar in his parents' home, taking up only one bedroom with brick walls and a dirt floor.  Currently, he works over eight hours a day growing vegetables.  With his earnings, he is able to pay for his food and basic needs. 

He will use this loan to purchase modified seeds that will help him because they do not require much water and the harvest time is quicker.  Rodrigo's dream is to purchase a tractor to facilitate his work because it is very exhausting to work all day, and sometimes it is very cold or hot.  This way, he will also improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase modified seeds for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase zinc sheets, bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestoria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nestoria is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nestoria has a banana business in the Philippines. Nestoria requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nestoria has been in this business for 18 years.  In the future, Nestoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 41 years old and married.  She has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Ma. Lourdes's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Lourdes has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Lourdes is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Oscar Benjamin

texts.es: Oscar tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hijo de 4 años y su hija de un año de edad. Oscar se dedica a la venta de helados (paletas) de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Oscar desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda dado que habita en condiciones muy humildes. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para proceder a repellar las paredes de la vivienda y encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que esta construida a base de adobe material que es propicio para que los insectos aniden.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife, his four-year old son and his one-year-old daughter.  Oscar works as a street vendor  selling popsicles in the main areas of his town.  Oscar wishes to improve his housing conditions as he currently lives in very poor conditions.

He has requested this loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of his home and lay cement on the floor, as the house was built of adobe, a material that is very suitable for insect nesting.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls of his home and lay cement on the floor.

loans.name: Chetene

texts.fr: Chetene est un jeune homme de 28 ans vivant en concubinage avec la maman de ses enfants.il a deux enfants donc l'aîné est âgé de 04 ans et le dernier de 02 ans.il a une petite alimentation il y a déjà 05 ans aujourd'hui il rencontre des grande difficulté pace qu'il n'arrive pas souvent a satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèles. Chetene a alors besoin du soutien pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoin de ses clients, pour pouvoir prendre soin de sa famille et de léguer plus tard.
texts.en: Chetene is a 28-year old man. He lives together with the mother of his children. He has two children: the oldest is four years old and the youngest two years old. He opened a small grocery store five years ago. At present he is experiencing difficulties because he is often unable to meet customer demand. Chetene needs support in order to be able to satisfy his customer’s needs, provide for his family and eventually pass on the store to his children.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise stock.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice in their field. Her children are attending school. Dolores is engaged in selling dry goods in the market. She sells various types of ready-to-wear clothes. With her earnings from her business, Dolores is able to provide her children allowances in school. Sometimes her profit from her business adds on her previous capital enabling her to buy more clothes to sell. But, due to her customers' requests to sell new fashions, Dolores decided to borrow P50,000. She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, casual attire, jackets and many more items. She believes that by selling new fashions of clothes she will satisfy her customers' wants. At the same time, Dolores will also increase her sales and income as well.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, casual attire, jackets and more.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Pacita has been in this business for 2 years. Pacita earns additional income from pig fattening.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending since 2013 and is now requesting a 10000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Marina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. Due to financial hardship, he aims to improve his hog-raising business to earn a higher income. He planned to acquire more pigs to raise but he has limited capital. Therefore, he is requesting for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy the additional pigs, as well as vitamins and feed for his hogs. Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that he will further improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, vitamins and feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 34 year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past four years.  He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.  Fouzia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling. Therefore, Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 
Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of commodities for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a farmer and a resident of Siongiroi area of South rift, Kenya.  She is married and has four children, all are of whom are school aged.  She has been doing farming for eight years. Her income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, maize, and vegetables. She enjoys tilling the land to make it ready for planting and also to remove weeds.
Juliana chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate.  During the training, she learned that microfinance institutions do take care of the welfare of small-holder farmers by giving them more opportunities for growth and development. This poultry loan will bring in more income and thus she will be able to cover her children's school fees and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 21 years old and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marilou's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending and is committed to regain what she lost.  Marilou is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Marilou has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, no esta casada pero tiene su pareja con el cual tuvo cuatro hijos, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra en la población del Palomar.
Actualmente trabaja junto a su pareja por mas de ocho horas al día dedicándose a la agricultura ya que deben cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia,ya que es el único ingreso con el que cuentan por ahora.
El crédito lo invertirán en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que es de mucha ayuda en su producción por que no necesita de mucho riego y la producción es en menor tiempo.
El sueño de Carmen es construir su casa para poder darles mas comodidad y seguridad a su familia también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is not married but has her life companion with whom she has four children. They live in their own house which consists of just one room with brick walls and dirt floors. The house is in the community of Palomar. She works eight hours a day beside her companion farming, as she must cover the costs of education, food and basic services for her family. And farming is the only income that they have at the present.

The loan will be used to purchase better seeds which will improve their production as they don't need much watering and grow in a shorter time. Carmen's dream is to build their house to be more comfortable and secure for the family and improve their quality of living..

loans.use: to buy better seeds.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon lives in the are of Siongiroi in South Rift, Kenya. She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are of school-going age. She is mainly a poultry farmer but she also sells milk,and a variety of crops as well. In farming, she enjoys ensuring that her livestock get enough feed, so that they will produce more. Her biggest challenges are lack of transport and dry seasons. 

Sharon chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan as they offer low interest rates on their loans and help farmers grow economically. During the training, she learned how to develop savings. This poultry loan will bring in more income for her. It will help her with her children's educations and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi, for eight years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of their entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more spending on maintenance, on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nabila has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Nabila's husband can afford the cost of taxi maintenance easily. And he can provide better transport services, to earn the profitable income. Nabila also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future. Nabila is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to afford the cost of taxi maintenance

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, who is the sole breadwinner for three members of his family. He was only fourteen years old when he had to start working, to make sure that he could cover his family's needs and requests. Ali works as a barber, which he has done since eight years ago. In 2008 he established his own shop. He is working hard to develop it frequently, to keep up with customers' needs and requests. Today his business is going on just fine. He has a stable base work, which he believes he can develop more, by increasing his provided services.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will use it to make necessary maintenance to his shop and keep it more attractive to his beloved customers, and to increase his business merchandise with special, newly-released beauty products. He hopes that in the future, he might expand his working place and add a specialized facial treatment department, to increase his services wisely.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his shop and to increase his business merchandise with newly-released beauty products

loans.name: Marga

texts.es:
Marga, no esta casada pero tiene su pareja con el cual tuvo tres hijos que están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día junto a su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a la producción de hortalizas y con los ingresos que tienen deben cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le es de mucha ayuda por que no necesita de mucho riego y la producciones en menos tiempo,de esta forma también mejoraran sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Marga es comprar mas hectáreas de tierra para aumentar su producción y de esta forma también sus ingresos,para darles mas comodidad a sus hijos y poder cubrir los gastos de educación posteriormente.
texts.en:
Marga is not married but lives with her life companion with whom she has 3 children who are all in school. They live in their own house which consists of only one room with brick walls and a dirt floor. They live in the community of Palomar. Along with her husband she works eight hours a day growing vegetables. With the income they have to cover the food and education expenses and pay for the basic services of the family. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of better seeds which will be much help as they don't need a lot of watering and grow in a shorter time. In this way they can improve their revenues and their quality of living. Marga's dream is to buy more hectares of land to increase her production. By doing this she would increase her revenues and provide her family with more comfort plus pay for their education expenses.

loans.use: to buy better seeds.

loans.name: Reynita

texts.en:
Reynita is 29 years old and married. She has three children, and two of her children are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Reynita requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Reynita would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and married. She has seven children, three of them in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, when it swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlene has restarted her business, and now she needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase materials for rebuilding her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlene is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor for rebuilding her family's home, which was destroyed by typhoon

loans.name: Nigat

texts.en:
Nigat is a 32-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, and grapes. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nigat's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for resale so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore Nigat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruits for resale

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 31 years old and has seven children, three of whom are still in school.  Leonida is married.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Leonida is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Leonida has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store. With your help, Leonida can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 42 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Gina requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 49 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Teresa has been pig fattening for 15 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa brinda sus servicios en la elaboracion de comida y de disponer adecuadamente las herramientas, utensilios y materiales de trabajo; organizar cavas, neveras y armarios; lavar, pelar, tornear ycortar legumbres, hortalizas, pescados y mariscos. Preparar fondos, ensaladas,salsas y participar en los inventarios. Además, colaborar con el cocinera en elservicio. Limpiar y ordenar su puesto de trabajo y colaborar en el arreglo generalde la cocina.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres en La Paz.Necesita credito para la construcción de una habitacion para que pueda vivir mas comodamente 
El sueño de Elsa es vivir en mejores condiciones y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa works making meals, arranges adequate tools, utensils and material for work. organizes the wine cellar, freezers and cupboards. washes, peels and cuts vegetables, greens, fish and seafood. She prepares broth, salads, sauces and does inventory. She also works with the cook in filling orders. She cleans and arranges her work space and helps with the general cleanliness of the kitchen.

Elsa lives with her parents in La Paz. She needs a loan to build a room so that she can live more comfortably. Her dream is to live in better conditions and with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her rice retailing business, a business she has been in since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Marissa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 37-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two daughters. Her husband has been working as a mason for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Fozia is also provides sewing services, and earns income to contribute with her husband in managing the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods (e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc) for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories, which will also be helpful in increasing her monthly sales and profit by providing a better sewing service.

Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Johnny is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 47 years old and has four children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, he aims to continue sending his children to school so that they will be employed someday. Due to high cost of school fees, he plans to expand his vegetable planting in order to increase his production. Having inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and pay the labor cost incurred in planting vegetables. He believes that his loan will be a great help for him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and pay the labor cost incurred in planting vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Temistocles

texts.en:
Temistocles is a 58-year-old married woman with nine children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Temistocles has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetables stall.

Temistocles would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetables stall.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 46-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Dilshad is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute to managing the household. 
She needs different kinds of goods (e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.) for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Dilshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Tupendane Kongowe Group

texts.en:
Athumani is a father of two children who are still in school. He is in his early thirties and for five years now he has made his living by managing a genge business--commonly known for selling fruits and vegetables. He works from 10am to 10pm every working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This is Athumani's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. Athumani successfully paid back his previous loans, which he used to improve his business by maintaining his daily demanded stock. He earned extra income, which he used to pay for some of his house building expenses and cover school fees and home expenses. He is really thankful to everyone who has shown interest in his group. Athumani dreams that one day he will be able to be a successful business man. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane Kongowe", which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and has five children. Her children are all being sent to school to study. Her husband works abroad as a seaman. 

With her desire to help her husband fulfill their needs even in a simple way, Mary Ann engages herself in a retailing business. She sells different commodities, like soap, toothpaste, and snack foods. 

Mary Ann wants to increase her sales and income, as well. She wants to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more grocery items to sell. She would be happy, if she can obtain the loan and extend the number of products she sells to her customers. Her earnings will serve as help to support her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Vicenta works hard to support her family. She buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Vicenta is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.  Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 33 years old and married, with three children. With two children currently in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Arlene has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, cooking oil, and noodles. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Annie works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from farming rice. Annie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials to be used in her furniture-making business.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to be used in her furniture business.

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, which makes him unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Naheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 
Naheeda is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make repairs to her husband's rickshaw to provide transport facilities

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and rice bran for her pig raising business.

Marita has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from buying and selling herbal medicines.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and rice bran.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 47, married, and raises his family in a rural community. Since farming is the main source of his family's livelihood, he plans to expand his vegetable farm to ensure a higher production. Due to financial constraint, he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his crops. Being patient and industrious, he believes that he will expand his farm and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his vegetable production

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, fishing net, etc. for her business. Analyn has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, and fishing net.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmen is 49-years-old and has four children who are currently in school.

Carmen has a general store business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Carmen has been in this business for five years. Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 28-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.  Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Naseem runs a small boutique at home where she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it and then sells it for a higher price in her community. The ladies of her town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to the attractive designs and colors. Her husband can afford all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for their savings. 

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis.  This is the reason she has requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Naseem wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ladies' garments for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Meet Josephine, who lives and does farming in the Nyamira area of Nyanza, Kenya. She is married and has 8 children and has been farming for 30 years. She enjoys farming because it brings in a lot of profit, especially from selling eggs.  She also sells milk, bananas, and tea. Her biggest challenge is limited funds.
Josephine chose Juhudi Kilimo because she wanted to purchase more chickens and their loans have an affordable interest rate. Juhudi also provides asset financing to small-scale farmers. This loan will bring in more income to her family and this will lead to an improvement of their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is 47 years old and widowed with one child. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Enriqueta has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been fattening pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF. In the future, Enriqueta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 30 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anecita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anecita has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store. Catalina has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending. Catalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: María Herculana

texts.es:
María, considera que los préstamos son de mucha ayuda para adquirir la materia prima con la que se mantiene trabajando y generando los ingresos con los que cumple con los diversos compromisos económicos que tiene, ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar pita plástica para tener el material con el que elaborar lazos y matates.
El préstamo anterior le facilito la compra de materia prima para mantenerse trabajando y mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
María believes that the loans are a big help in getting raw material, which she uses to keep working and generating income.  She uses the income to meet the different financial obligations that she has.

She is requesting a new loan to buy plastic cord in order to have the material to make rope and string tote bags.

The previous loan facilitated the purchase of raw material in order to keep working and to improve the family’s finances.

loans.use: to buy plastic cord.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, cement blocks, and wood.

loans.name: Evame

texts.en:
Evame is 22 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, eggs, etc.

Evame has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, es casada, vive junto a dos de sus hijas y cuatro nietos, ella desde que era una niña aprendió a vender fruta picada, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., es una actividad que no representa riesgos y hasta la fecha a administrado muy bien.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de una mesa metálica con la dará una mejor imagen a su negocio, y también invertirá en la compra de sandías, piñas, melones, mangos, bolsas. Espera atraer a nuevos clientes y así aumentar sus ventas para tener más ganancias, las cuales utilizara para pagar la deuda adquirida y cubrir los gastos familiares.
El sueño de Felipa es tener un chalet para vender nuevos productos como licuados, lácteos y más variedad de frutas.
texts.en:
Felipa is married and lives with two of her daughters and four grandkids. Since she was a little girl she learned to sell chopped fruit; her working hours are from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm. It is an activity that doesn’t represent risks, and until this day she has managed the business quite well. 

She will use the money to buy a metal table, which will improve the image of her business, and she’ll also buy watermelons, pineapples, melons, mangoes, and bags. She hopes to attract new clients and increase her sales to get more profits, which she will use to pay the contracted debt and to cover the household expenditures.

Felipa’s dream is to have a snack bar to sell new products, like shakes, dairy and a larger variety of fruits.

loans.use: to buy a metal table, watermelons, pineapples, melons, mangoes, and bags.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir (chamarras y sacos), principalmente de tela y fibra. 

Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en El Alto Necesita credito para comprar telas e hilos para su negocio

El sueño de Efrain es terminar sus estudios y ejercer con su propio negocio. Asi brindar mejor servicio con calidad.
texts.en:
Efrain makes clothing (jackets and coats), mainly from fabric and fibers.  He lives with his parents in El Alto.  He needs this loan to buy fabric and thread for his business.

Efrain’s dream is to finish school and start his own business so he can provide better quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela se dedica a la venta de utencilios, calderas, juegos de ollas de tistintos materiales de calidad optima en su presentación al gusto del cliente.

Ella vive en casa de un familiara en La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar ollas pues es uno de sus productos mas vendidos 

El sueño de Marcela es abrir una almacen de todo lo que ella vende pero lo mas pronto que ella sueña es tener su propia casa, asi habitar en mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela sells utensils, caldrons, clay pots, all of good quality to present to her customers.

She lives with her family in La Paz and needs this loan to buy pots, which are her best sellers.

Marcela’s dream is to open a store that sells her products, but dreams of having her own house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Dominga de 60 años de edad es separada con 01 hija independiente. Ella es parte del grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” y está formado por 08 socios responsables. Dominga se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Gracias a su constante dedicación pudo educar a su hija y salir adelante en su negocio. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche. El grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Dominga es la primera del lado derecho y viste chaleco negro.
texts.en: Dominga is 60 years old, separated, and has an adult daughter.  She is a member of the “Unión Por El Progreso“group, made up of 8 responsible members.  Dominga sells groceries and thanks to her constant dedication, her daughter was able to attend school and she herself was able to get ahead with her business.  She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and milk.  The “Unión Por El Progreso” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.  Dominga is the first on the right, wearing a black vest.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Houeida

texts.en:
Houeida is a 44-year-old, single woman, who is the sole breadwinner to three members of her family.

Houeida has been employed in a restaurant for seven years. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing her career to provide her family with the necessary living needs.

Houeida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to pay for lawyer expenses. The lawyer is working hard to keep Houeida and her family members at home living peacefully or to find the suitable solution to make sure they are going to remain capable of having a safe roof to peacefully live underneath.

Houeida hopes that, one day, she can establish her own business and provide a better living for her beloved family members.

loans.use: to pay for lawyer expenses.

loans.name: Edelma

texts.es:
Edelma realizar trabajos por cuenta propia son mantas artesanales de vicuña realisadas con ruecas rusticas desde el hilado hasta el proceso de acabado de la manta.Tambien con lana normal a tejido a groche con un acabado unico y calidad.

Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en La Paz. Necesita credito para refaccion de vivienda pues tiene problemas con filtración de agua 

El sueño de Edelma es, producir mas mantas de vicuña asi poder llegar a  exportar mantas artesanales de vicuña sin perder la tradicion y cultura Boliviana. Asi poder brindar una buena calidad de servicio al comprador y a su familia. Construir su vivienda y brindar mejor habitad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edelma makes artistic wool blankets, handcrafted with rustic materials, from threads to the finished product.  She also uses regular yarn, giving it a unique, high quality finish.

She lives in a home of her own, located in La Paz and needs this loan to make repairs to her home because she has problems with water leaks.

Edelma’s dream is to make more wool blankets and be able to export them without losing the Bolivian culture.  In this way she will be able to provide quality service to her purchasers and to her family.  She will also be able to build up her house and provide a home for her children.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Carmen Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 9, 12 y un año de edad, junto a su esposo luchan por salir adelante con su familia, él se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y ella a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.
Se dispone a surtir su inventario de ropa con nuevos estilos, colores y tallas para ofrecer a sus clientes mercadería de calidad y a buen precio, Marisol comprara pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas, ropa interior para ambos sexos, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía con lo que podrá cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas, así como también continuar apoyando a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Su anhelo es tener recursos económicos suficientes para brindar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol is married and the mother of three children, ages 1, 9, 12.  She and her husband strive to get ahead with her family.  He sells natural medicines and clothing on foot.  He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

She wants to increase her inventory with new styles, colors, and sizes to offer quality materials at good prices to her customers.  Marisol will buy pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, and undergarments for both sexes.  She expects to increase her sales, improve her financial situation, be able to pay off her debt on time, and continue helping her husband with the family expenses.

She wants to have the enough financial resources to better feed and clothe her family and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María, le complace decir que con el crédito anterior tuvo la posibilidad de adquirir muchos productos nuevos con los que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos ya que encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar y a precios accesibles.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo que utilizara en la compra de aceite, huevos, azúcar, bebidas, galletas, dulces, granos básicos, entre otros, con lo que se mantendrá vendiendo y  teniendo los ingresos necesarios para solventar la nueva deuda y continuar  apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is pleased to say that with the previous loan she was able to acquire a lot of new products, with which her customers feel satisfied, since now they can find what they need in one place and at reasonable prices.

She has decided to request a new loan that she will use to buy oil, eggs, sugar, beverages, cookies, candies, basic staples, and other items. This will allow her to continue with her sales, have the necessary incomes to pay for this new debt, and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, sugar, beverages, cookies, candies, basic staples, and other items.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old single man. He started providing barber services in March 2012. 

His business is doing just fine, and he is very proud of the level of success he has reached. He works on developing his business as much as he can and makes sure that almost all of his customers' needs and requests are properly met.

Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Mohamad needs to maintain his beloved car which is necessary for making transportation easier to and from work. He uses his car for his special barber services which he provides to some customers at their homes upon their request.

Mohamad hopes that in the future he can develop his business more and increase the number of employees.

loans.use: to maintain his car

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. 

She started sewing eight years ago to support her family and provide a better education for her children. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices. 

Analyn is requesting a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to buy a new sewing machine and table so she can increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing for the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and table

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years now.

Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 26 years old, married, hardworking and an independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for the nearby factories; her husband brings cloth from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuously working. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.
Humaira thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 57 years old and lives with her two children in a rural community. Due to unavoidable circumstances, she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift their status of living and give her children a better life. 

Aside from farming, she engages in raising hogs to have an additional source of income. She aims to acquire more pigs to raise, but she has inadequate funds. 

Catalina is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins for her hogs. She believes that this financial assistance will make it possible to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old and married with four children. Two children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 27 years.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the Nyamira area of Nyanza, Kenya, a banana-growing area. He is married and has four children, all of school-going age. He has been farming for nine years and his primary income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea, bananas and maize. He enjoys farming because of the profit he gets from selling dairy milk and meat. His biggest challenge is insufficient funds.

Robert wants to construct a cattle shed and that's why he chose Juhudi Kilimo to help him financially and to help him gain knowledge of farming when the loan officers train the farmers before giving out loans to them. During the training, he also learned that MFIs support low income earners. This loan will enable him to get more income and thus will cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: to construct a cattle shed.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
Marta, a administrado de manera adecuada sus préstamos es por eso que con la ayuda del crédito anterior ella tuvo la semilla de marañón necesaria para continuar vendiendo, además ha incluido la venta de mariscos con el fin de generar ingresos extras que necesita para mejorar las circunstancias familiares y solventar sus deudas.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar pescado, camarones y semilla de marañón, lo que le permitirá mantener en el mercado ambas actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marta has managed her loans well, so she was able to have the cashew seed she needed to keep selling.  She has also started selling seafood to generate extra income to improve her family circumstances and pay her debts. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy fish, shrimp, and cashew seeds, which will allow her to stay in the market for both products.

loans.use: to buy seefood and cashew seed.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida, age 35, is a married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband has been running a small toy shop in his community. He offers a variety of toys at reasonable prices, and he has retained many customers who often shop at his store. Mostly it is children who are attracted to his shop; they insist that their parents buy toys.
