loans.use: to buy scrap material in bulk for recycling purpose.

loans.name: Chutthavy

texts.en:
Chutthavy is 42 years old, a farmer, and lives in Chhloung district, Kracheh province. She is married and has 10 children, some of whom lives with her and her husband. Her main activities are farming and sales of rice and cassavas, which she does one after another respectively. She works arduously so she can feed her family and provide for their basic necessities. She has been a farmer for more than 14 years, and earns a daily income of USD 8.00.

As of now, she is asking for a loan, which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members, so as to improve her household sanitation practices. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Chutthavy is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Siperanza

texts.en:
Siperanza has rental houses, which she rents out for an income every month. This has been her business for 14 years now. She is 58 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children; three of whom are grown ups and one is in high school. 

She will be using this loan to buy building materials, such as sand, cement, stones, and others to use in finishing the construction of some rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to renovate other houses.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials for building rental houses.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fresh fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Saleeqa

texts.en:
Saleeqa is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore, Saleeqa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Saleeqa is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's Rickshaw.

loans.name: Fortunata Angelica

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 66 años de edad y es casada, ella nació y  vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se siente alegre por vivir en esta ciudad. Fortunata es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es elaborar ropa para bebes y niños, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana.
texts.en: Fortunata is 66 years old and married. She was born in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru, and she still lives there. She feels happy to live in this city. Fortunata is an enterprising woman who is helping her family get ahead. Her main economic activity is making clothing for babies and children. She belongs to the "Huayna Picchu" communal bank of the Arariwa Association. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy wool.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is 35 years old, divorced and has 2 children.  

She is going to start her own business because she needs the money.  She had no opportunity to start her own business before now.  She took part in a competition ‘The best business plan’ organized by Association Business Women and she wrote her business plan. 

She wants to open beauty salon to service the local people. She also will rent wedding dresses. She is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy beauty salon equipment and to pay for dress storage. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment and to pay for dress storage for her new business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and has a beauty salon business, which she has been running for five years now, and gives her a monthly income of KES 20,000. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stocks of beauty products for use in her salon, including hair braids and several types of hair oil. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hope is to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for use in her salon.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 47 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children.  She farms and has a green house and has been in this business for 5 years now. Her monthly income is KES 60,000.

She will be using this loan to start a horticulture business as she has found a niche in it and wants to expand her business. She will also buy water pipes for her greenhouse. She anticipates making more income, which she will use to expand her farming business. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To start a horticulture business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pastries, snacks, basic staple foods, juices and canned products.

loans.name: Jamleck

texts.en:
Jamleck has been making and selling shoes in Nairobi town for the past 8 years. He is 48 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children. He also supports 3 people in his family.

He will be using this loan to buy more materials for making shoes such as more shoe soles, shoe laces and shoe shining materials. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. He hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making shoes such as more shoe soles, shoe laces and shoe shining materials.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 36 years old, married and, together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children, ages four and two years old. He repairs bicycles and motorcycles and he has been in this business for ten years now.

Nicholus will be using the loan to buy tools for his repair business, like spanners, nuts, brake oil, tubes, and chains. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to save more.

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully paid his previous loans. His future hopes are to see his children get a good education, up to university and beyond, and also to open other kinds of businesses.

loans.use: to buy tools, such as spanners, brake oil, and tubes.

loans.name: Elizabeth Kabura

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of 4 girls, 2 in high school and the other 2 in primary school.   She is an entrepreneur selling milk, eggs, vegetables, fruits, sugarcane and cereals next to her home to sustain her family.  These she buys at a bigger market and sells them to her local neighbours, apart from milk and eggs, which she gets from her own 3 cows and chicken.  

Veronicah has been one of the biogas promoters (though she doesn't have one herself) because she knew it was the only way to save other women in her community the burden of walking long distances, through unsafe pathways, carrying heavy loads of firewood.

With a biogas credit, now she has constructed a biodigester of 8m3 to produce enough gas for cooking and showering. She hopes after the completion her husband and children will no longer have to wait for her to come cook or warm food since the biogas stove is easy to light and use. With the biogas shower, her family will also enjoy warm baths every day, improving on their hygiene.

Elizabeth is now happy that she can use her own biodigester to demonstrate it others as a way of promoting and marketing it.

loans.use: To construct a Biodigester

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and she has a green grocery store. She is single and has one child, nine years old. Gladys has been in the business for five years now and she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Gladys plans to use the loan to purchase stocks of vegetables to sell and she will use the anticipated profits to educate her child. 

This is Gladys' first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her hopes and dreams in the future are to be successful in her business and to be able to educate her child for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children and husband.  Her husband has had his own business raising livestock for the past twenty years.  He is the guardian of the family and is responsible for managing the household.

Kalsoom's husband needs to buy feed and other merchandise for his livestock business, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in the position to buy these items for his business.

Therefore, Kalsoom has requested Kiva fund a loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will assist her husband to buy above these items for his business so that he can earn the maximum income to manage his business and household.

For this financial assistance, Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy feed and other merchandise for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as a rainy city. Din manages a small shop selling groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Din is married and living with his son and wife in the family home.  

Din joined Ruma six months ago because he wanted to sell new products.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Din has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $37 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Tembo Grp Group

texts.en:
Chacha is a married man who aged in the early forties. He has five children who are in school. 

For three years now, Chacha has made his living by running a retail shop, selling items like vouchers, rice, maize and baking flour, cooking oil, kerosene, sugar, beans, match boxes, and many more. His his shop is open from 07am to 06pm daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Chacha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy new business stock to sell. 

Chacha dreams that one day he will be able to open another big shop. 

He will share this loan with his loan group,"TEMBO GRP", which consists of six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business stock to sell.

loans.name: Jhoni

texts.en:
Jhoni lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as a rainy city. Jhoni manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Jhoni is married and living with his daughter and wife in the family home.  

Jhoni joined Ruma three months ago because he wanted to sell new products.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Jhoni has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $35  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is a 34-year-old woman. She is a widow, and brings up a daughter and a son alone. She earns money working as a seller of different kinds of tableware and tablecloths. She has worked in this area for 15 years, and has already learned everything of her customers and their demands. This is the only source of family’s income, and her monthly income is 130AZN.

Azerbaijan cuisine is very various and rich. There are different kinds of dishes and desserts, and each of them has its own kind of plate. Azerbaijanis like to decorate their tables when they have guests, holidays, parties, even for daily breakfast, dinner and supper. Local people like to attend Aynur’s shop, because she has beautiful plates and tablecloths with beautiful ornaments and patterns. 

Aynur needs money to provide her children a primary education. She wants them to become well-educated, and be able to provide them a good life in the future. She doesn’t want them to live a hard life as she does herself. 

She applied for a 1000AZN loan in order to buy new kinds of tableware and tablecloths, and make the shop’s assortment wider. 

She hopes this will increase her monthly income.  This is her fourth loan.  

Aynur is a very responsible woman and has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of tableware and tablecloths

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is married and has two little children. 

Safiya is a successful business lady. She has been busy with growing watermelon and maize. She grows in a land which is located near her house. 

She began her business in this field five years ago. Safiya works hard, but still she has a small income. 

She is going to sow watermelon and maize, but she has no money. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoji to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her sowing land

loans.name: Bagonia Group

texts.en:
“The creation of beauty is an art,” says 34-year-old Lalfakawmi. Warm, kind-hearted and soft-spoken, Lalfakawmi is the featured borrower for Bagonia Group. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is a mother of two kids, runs a beauty salon, and also supports her husband in generating an income for the family.  Bagonia Group members live in Mizoram. It is one of the northeastern states in India.

“I love the art of beautifying especially women,” shares Lalfakawmi. She is talented, skillful and interested in her profession. She can trim and cut hair, give facial massage, pedicure, manicure treatment, hair spa etc. The salon is in her house and customers usually come to the house for the treatment. The service charge is low compared to the salon shop in the main market, which is a disadvantage in generating an income. 

Her husband is a daily wage earner and his income is small, irregular and unreliable.  Lalfakawmi manages the salon and at the same time takes care of all the household chores. The salon is at its busiest during weekends as most of the government offices and other institutions are closed. Working women visit the salon on weekends only. On other days, she also sells used clothes and Tupperware products to make extra income.

With the help of the Kiva loan, she will purchase beauty products and accessories which will include pedicure kits and parlour chairs. She has plans to expand her salon and before that, she will take another hair and beauty refresher course. She says, ‘Thank you so much, Kiva!” and says she is more inspired and motivated to make her dreams come true. Her dream is to open a standard beauty salon in the heart of Aizawl town. She will work very hard and will also repay the loan on time. The relationship between Kiva and the group will also be strengthened and she wishes to continue working with Kiva and WSDS.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in tailoring and beauty salons.

loans.use: To purchase a good quality facial kit and advanced tools for the beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tub, cosmetics, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as a rainy city. Nur manages a small shop selling groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Nur is married and living with his daughter, son and wife in the family home.  

Nur joined Ruma nine months ago because he wanted to sell new products.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nur has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $31 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Rabbina

texts.en:
Rabbina is from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 28 years old and is a housewife. She lives there with her husband and two school-going sons. Both husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their sons are studying in grade 1 and grade 8.  They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Rabbina's husband is engaged in agricultural work. He owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates different vegetables.  He sells the gathered harvest in the local market and earns for the family, which is vital for them. As the income from this business is not sufficient for covering the family 's daily costs along with their children's educational expenses, they thought to start potato cultivation in their agricultural land.

Rabbina is a very proactive and hardworking woman who does her best to sustain her husband's agricultural business. In order to expand the agricultural business, Rabbina has applied for a loan from BJS.  Realising that land cultivation is very important for their family,Rabbina would like to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for a bigger harvest.

They hope to earn an additional profit from this business to reach their goals of educating their sons properly, giving a better financial condition to their family, and lastly upgrading their house to a concrete-made house,

Rabbina is thankful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and a daughter; her children are doing study. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for six years; he is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Ghazala is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothes for her husband's cloth selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Chhabi

texts.en:
Chhabi is a 48-year-old housewife from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Brojen who is a 55-year-old farmer.  They are blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter).  One of the sons is a mason, the other goes to college and their only daughter is in grade 12. Chhabi, though illiterate, can sign her name.

In search of a source of funding for her family, Chhabi's husband started his agricultural activities 10 years back.  He works hard on his agricultural land from dawn to dusk to earn a livelihood for his family.  He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the harvest in the local market with the help of Chhabi and his children.  Yet, his income is hardly sufficient to give a decent lifestyle to the members of his family.

To further develop their agribusiness, Chhabi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.  She hopes to improve the business with the loan.  Potato is a very important vegetable that is used widely in India.  So they hope to earn a good profit from this business.  She dreams of fulfilling her desires to give a proper education to her children so that they can be established in life.  The additional profit will help them to cover all the necessary expenses and she hopes to purchase a tractor in the future with the profit, which will help them in their work.

Her full thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 27 years old; he lives in Gaza with his family, only one of whom is employed and helping him in providing the family income.
In the first of May 2010, Murad opened his own barbershop. He has one employee to help him, because his costumers have continuously increased; he is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a hair dryer, aluminum door and air conditioner for his shop.  

This will increase the number of the clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, aluminum door and air conditioner for his shop.

loans.name: Nishon

texts.en: Nishon was born in 1957. He is a hardworking man who always tries for the well being of his family. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife.  He works in an organization as an accountant. He wants his children to be highly educated people. His son studies at the first course. He studies well, but Nishon does not have enough money to pay for his son’s education. He is asking for a loan of 750 USD to pay for his son’s education. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is a married woman from the small village of Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 29 years old, illiterate and can sign only her name. Unfortunately, due to the lack of finances, she was not able to study.  Her husband Jakir is 35 years old and studied up to grade 6. Together they are raising one daughter and one son. One of the children is a student in grade 6 and the other one is below school-going age.

Nasima's husband is engaged in a small business.  His earnings are too scanty to cover the family's needs. Nasima is a hardworking lady. She wants to help her husband financially.  Thus, she desires to start a grocery shop where she will sell food items in small amounts such as rice, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs etc.  

In order to fulfill her desire, she has taken a loan from BJS to buy grocery items. She hopes she will have a better income, which will help her to improve the financial conditions of her family. She wants to give her children a good education and to see them become highly professional.

Nasima is thankful to the lenders, Kiva and BJS for the loan.

loans.use: To buy a variety of grocery items to start a grocery shop.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 47-year-old Palestinian Refugee, living in a Palestinian camp and working hard to improve both her business and her family's living.

Alia is a married mother of four children.  She works hard to support and provide them with their necessary living needs, especially the necessary education which she thinks is the most important thing she can give them.

For the past thirty years, Alia has worked as a tailor from her house. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to improve and develop her work place to attract new customers, in addition to buying necessary business merchandise such as needles, threads and buttons.

She works hard so that in the future she might open a separate working place when she feels that she can afford the increase in expenses.

loans.use: to buy necessary merchandise such as needles, threads and buttons

loans.name: Las Optimistas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Optimistas está formado por 8 mujeres que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, es una ciudad de clima frió, tienen una geografía accidentada la cual le da el colorido de bellos paisajes. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma que trabajan arduamente cada día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys,  forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Optimistas desde hace 9 años, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijas de 18, 16, 14 y 6 años de edad, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que vive es propia fruto del trabajo conyugal.
Doña Gladys es de profesión costurera, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace varios años, le gusta mucho esta actividad y a su trabajo lo dedica de 8 a 10 horas diarias de lunes a sábados. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar telas y libros para el estudio de sus hijas. Su sueño es que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The 'Las Optimistas' group is formed by eight women who live in various places in the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999. It is bathed by four rivers and is a city with a cold climate. It has a hilly geography that gives color to beautiful landscapes. Like the members of the group, its people are friendly and kind and have great charisma. They work arduously each day to improve their household finances.

One of the members of this group is Gladys. She has been part of the 'Las Optimistas' loan group for the last nine years. She is 39 years old and married, and from her marriage she has four daughters aged 18, 16, 14 and 6. Her husband is a mechanic. They own the house they live in thanks to their efforts as a couple.

Gladys is a seamstress. She has done this work for many years. She likes this work a lot and dedicates 8 to 10 hours a day to her work from Monday to Saturday. The money from her loan is to buy fabrics and books for her daughters' studies. Her dream is for her daughters to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and books

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 21-years-old.  He lives in Gaza and sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it one year ago.

Mahmoud is requesting this youth loan to purchase a refrigerator. This will allow him to increase his stock, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  He hopes that he can remain capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

Mahmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve a successful business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 21 years old and he lives in Gaza  His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education.  Now, he has a poultry farm, with two employees.  He started his business in 2011.

He needs this youth loan to expand the poultry yard, which will help him to improve financial conditions for his family.  He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income. 

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand the poultry yard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of flashlights, wallets, combs, sweets, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion and used clothes for her business,

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 46-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children.  Now they are growing old and their needs are growing as well. 

Her husband conducts a business and provides services carrying sand and soil from one place to another by utilizing a tractor trolley. He has been doing this work for many years and generates a reasonable income for his family. Nowadays, his tractor trolley has broke due to overloading and jerks over the roads. He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. Due to this reason he is unable to continue his services and his earnings are zero. 

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  Her husband will use this amount to maintain the tractor trolley so that he can start his services again. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband maintain his tractor trolley.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en: Nato is a 39-year-old married woman from Tbilisi. She lives with her husband and 3 school-aged daughters. Nato's husband had a small car parts business, which is temporarily suspended. The 5-member family's current income comes from Nato's private activity, working as a dressmaker. Unfortunately, this is hardly enough to meet basic needs and daily costs. Nato generates a small income and has a great desire to expand her activity. She wants to use the requested loan to purchase 2 sewing machines, rent the place and open a workshop. Nato will get more orders and increase productivity. Nato and her family rely on the good will of lenders.

loans.use: To open a sewing workshop

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, 54 years old, is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a shoemaker by profession; he has been running his business for the past five years and he is also responsible for feeding the entire family.

Shaheen's husband wants to buy leather, needles, nails, etc. for his business but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy these accessories. Therefore, Shaheen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to assist her husband in buying these accessories and enabling him to earn the maximum profitable income. Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy leather, needles, nails, etc. for her husband's business

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.en:
Rajabmo, a widowed mother of a 12-year-old daughter, began her sewing business 10 years ago. Rajabmo sews women's national dresses and has regular clients who appreciate the high quality of her products. 

Because her sewing machine is broken, Rajabmo is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy a new one. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Women Of Gold Group

texts.en:
The "Women of Gold" groups consists of 8 members whose efforts and struggles have brought them to join ID-Ghana for their first loan. They sell fried plantain chips, bed sheets, cooking oil, wigs, dry pepper, fish, gari (cassava flour) and secondhand clothing. 

Beatrice is the representative borrower; she has been selling cooking oil and gari for 12 years. She is applying for this loan to buy more cooking oil and gari to sell to customers. This will help her to finalize her business plan and thus improve her income.

Together with their colleagues, the group members have received orientation about loans and microfinance, so they are aware of the work and efforts expected from them in a continuous and permanent manner to ultimately be successful and provide a better life for their families. They continuously monitor training and verification that somehow requires and also encourages the women to fight to escape poverty. The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,900 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and gari (cassava flour) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil, 34 years old, is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is married and has two daughters. All members of the family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Ramil's wife is a housekeeper; she brings up the children and sometimes works as a laborer when she has free time. Ramil has earned money working as a farmer for 10 years. He grows seasonal fruits (persimmon, quince, apples, etc.) and then sells them at the local bazaar. Ramil gets 200 AZN monthly and, unfortunately, it’s not enough for him to cover life demands.

Azerbaijan cuisine is various and rich, especially sweets and desserts. People like to eat fresh fruits and use them for preparing sweets. They make delicious quince or persimmon jams to eat for tea, cakes, cookies, etc. They also know that these fruits are very useful for health.

Ramil needs to cover his family’s demands but his income is very low. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to buy new sorts of fruit trees and new garden tools. He also wants to build a small greenhouse for his garden because the weather in his region is very cold and harmful for trees. Ramil hopes that one day he will be able to make life better for his children. Let’s help Ramil to reach his aim.

loans.use: to build a small greenhouse for his garden and to buy new garden tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to attract her customers.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 25 years old, married, uneducated and a housewife.  She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter).  Her husband Rafikul, aged 40 years, is a trader of cows. One of their sons and their daughter go to school and are in grade 5 and 4; the third child is below school-going age. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw, wood and bamboo) in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Farida's husband is associated with buying and selling cattle, especially cows. It is a revenue-generating business. With a solid 15 years of experience in this business, he buys cows from wholesale markets and resells them in local markets. He is the main breadwinner for the family. Due to the growing increase in the prices of essential commodities, it is now difficult for him to cover the family’s needs. He needs to expand his business in order to satisfy his customers, who are in ever-growing numbers.

Farida has taken a loan from BJS. She will utilize the loan to purchase another cow. This will increase their income, which will be used to meet her family’s needs, children's educational expenses, and in the future, to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She is grateful to a Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for business purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Leidy Giovanna

texts.es:
La historia que les quiero contar es la de una mujer llamada Leidy Giovanna, ella tiene 31 años de edad y en este momento esta estudiando auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto.
Leidy es una persona muy responsable tiene dos hijos uno de 14 años y otro de 11 ellos están estudiando, también vive en unión libre con la pareja, el es conductor, viven en un apartamento en arriendo.
A Leidy siempre le a gustado mucho esta profesión de la enfermería, pues le gusta mucho ayudar a los demás y piensa que gracias a esta carrera lo va poder hacer mucho mejor al igual que poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a los hijo, pero en estos momentos debido al estudio y a los hijos pues no a podido trabajar y a el esposo le queda difícil  pagarle las cuotas mensuales por lo mismo pide el convenio de kiva.
texts.en:
The story I want to tell you about is that of Leidy Giovanna. She is 31 years old and at this time is studying to be a Nursing Aide at Alto Campo. Leidy is a very responsible person who has two children aged 11 and 14 who are studying. She lives in a common-law relationship with her partner in a rented apartment. He is a driver.

Leidy has always liked the nursing profession as she likes to help others. She thinks that thanks to this profession she can do that a lot and at the same time provide a better standard of living for her children. But at the moment due to her studies and the children she can't work. It is difficult for her husband to pay the monthly installments, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan, 40 years old, is the mother of three children. Her husband conducts a small firm in which he has installed a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories and hires laborers to work on the molding machines for daily wages. Hanifan's husband needs different categories and qualities of raw materials for the manufacturing of different plastic accessories. He has taken a huge contract but does not have enough cash in hand to buy crushing raw material to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, Hanifan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushing plastic raw material for manufacturing.
 
Hanifan has to look after a huge family; she has to take care of each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes, she has need of a huge income and her husband is the sole person responsible for bearing household expenses. Hanifan is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Sabli

texts.en:
Sabli is from the small village of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband, Jamsher, and two children (one son and one daughter).  Sabli is 37 years old and has a primary education. Her husband attended school up to grade 8.

The family is engaged in agriculture. They rent a plot of land where vegetables are cultivated. Unfortunately, because of financial difficulties, Sabli and her family are not able to purchase and have their own land. They gather the harvest, sell it in the nearby markets and get money, which is their only source of income. In order to grow their business for more income, they have decided to cultivate potatoes.

Sabli has taken a loan from BJS to be able to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start growing potatoes. It is a very important vegetable, so they hope to earn a good profit from it. This will enable her to support her family economically and save a little money to upgrade their kachha house to a concrete-made house.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and red oil in order to have her soap business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Siphila Njeri

texts.en:
Siphila Njeri is a farmer and businesswoman operating a small shop next to her house. She started benefiting from renewable energy in 2012, having bought her first solar lamp, and thereafter she bought two more lamps. Happily, she shares with us how much she has enjoyed life while using a solar lantern which has helped her save at least 50% of the money she previously used on kerosene. The lamps that she bought are used to light the sitting room for her children to study, the kitchen and the master bedroom. Now, she does not need to buy kerosene anymore for lighting.

Her neighbors, having seen her lamp, have been sending her to buy on their behalf, and out of this, she saw an opportunity. She decided to stock the lamps in her shop so that she could make a margin, and at the same time, the customers can access the lamps easily. VEP has advanced her a business loan that would enable her purchase the first few months' stock, plowing back the profit while repaying the loan to grow the business. She hopes that she will be the biggest retailer of solar lamps in her community in the next year. The added income from the sale of the lanterns will improve the family's financial status.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamps for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 31 years old, single and supports his mother. He sells new clothes in Marigat town and has been in the business for a period of 14 years, earning an income of 31,000 KES.

With his ninth term loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, he intends to purchase a variety of new clothes for resale. The anticipated amounts will be used to repay the loan and support his mother. His dream is to have a family and expand his current business.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 41 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children. She sells secondhand clothes and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Lucy plans to use this loan to buy bails of mats and towels for resale in her business.  She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and pay back the loan. This is Lucy's first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to be successful in her business and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of mats and towels for resale

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 46-year-old housewife. She is married to Naba, and they are raising three children (two sons and one daughter) together. They live in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud) in Dhupguri town in the district of Jalpaiguri. Kalpana and her husband have completed grade 7 and 6 only. One of her children is studying higher secondary education, and the others are engaged in the vegetable business. Her husband is a farmer and grows different types of vegetables, and her children sell them in their local market. 

Kalpana has decided to give financial assistance to her husband. Thus, she started her business of selling sarees (an Indian traditional dress). She sells sarees mainly to her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. Her saree business is not good enough to support a decent lifestyle. Due to the lack of capital, she could not purchase more varieties of sarees. She would like to get a loan From BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy varieties of sarees and expand her business to meet her customers’ needs, as well as to upgrade her family’s financial condition. 

The profits generated from her business will be used to build up her savings and also help her to give her child a better education. Her dream is to open a saree shop in the local market in order to expand their business.

Kalpana is a lady with great enthusiasm who never wants to stop fighting. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of sarees (an Indian traditional dress) for selling.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a video show business which he has been running for the past seven years. He is 25 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with one child. He currently makes a monthly income of 60,000 KES, and his business has been profitable.

He will be using this loan to buy a DStv dish and decoder as well as a television screen. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is Joseph's third term loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid back his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy a television screen, a DStv dish and decoder.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old, married and together with her spouse they are blessed with four children. She farms, sells clothes and cards, and also has a grocery stall. She has been in the business for ten years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She plans to use the loan to increase her grocery stock with items such as vegetables and fruits. She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land and also to repay the loan. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hope is to be successful in the business.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is still happily married to Joseph and her three children are also well. She is still in the dairy farming business and her monthly has remained the same since her last loan.

Cicilia has applied for her third loan with Vision fund Kenya and she plans to use the entire loan amount to buy a heifer. In the future, she wants to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children. Mary sells clothes and traditional materials (Leso) in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for five years and currently her monthly income from her business is KES 40,000. She is also a farmer and her spouse also provides additional income.

Mary will be using this loan to buy bedsheets and materials for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more materials to sell as well as to repay the loan.

This is Mary's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to educate her children up to tertiary level and to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and materials for resale

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been working in agriculture for many years. Zahida grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to make huge profits, Zahida requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy seeds, good quality soil, and packs of insecticide. This will enable her to grow more crops to meet market demand consistently. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, good quality soil, and packs of insecticide.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling vegetables with her son (also shown in the photo) for the past six years. They have become famous in their locality for providing fresh vegetables and they make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Shamim has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Shamim is in her third loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, ginger, and apples.  This will help her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, ginger, and apples.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 51-year-old married woman. Nine years ago she started her business selling clothes in her locality as her husband’s income was not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone. Imtiaz buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her locality. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

At present, Imtiaz is requesting a loan of PKR 45,000, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different sizes by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different sizes.

loans.name: Rhodes Mireille

texts.fr: Mireille est une jeune femme de 32 ans , mère de famille. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Mireille is a 32-year old woman and a mother. After receiving her training, she opened a beauty salon and has been managing it for two years already. She often faces running out of cosmetic supplies, braided hair extensions and hair pieces because she buys retail. Her goal is to meet customer demand and have sizeable earnings. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy her supplies wholesale and meet her goal. The revenues derived from this loan will allow her to support herself and her child as well as save money in order to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her stock of cosmetic products, braided hair extensions and hair pieces.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children; one of her sons is shown in the photo with her and runs a small general store in their community. He has three years of experience in this field. He makes a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures. For the improvement of her son’s business, Shahnaz requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her son's store. She is expecting a boost in his earnings and dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more  fish, meat, rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small, simple house. Ramzi has been working in a small sewing workshop for the past eight years. He opened it in a small room in his house. It is a good business and earns a good income.

Ramzi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new textile for his sewing workshop. By taking this loan, Ramzi will be able to improve his business and his family's living conditions.

Ramzi appears in the photo in his sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy new textile for his sewing workshop.

loans.name: Melquisedec

texts.es: Melquisedec es un humilde joven de 33 años de edad, trabajador dedicado a la actividad de la ganadería junto a su esposa, así mismo comercializa productos de raíces y tubérculos, no tienen hijos aun, ponen todo su empeño a su actividad laboral. Melquisedec requiere este crédito para comprar quequisque para venderlo en el mercadito de su pueblo, así garantizar sus ingresos  diarios.
texts.en: Melquisedec is a humble 33 year old man. He is a hardworking man who works in the activity of ranching with his wife. He also sells root vegetables and tubers. They have no children yet and put all of their efforts into their work activity. Melquisedec needs this loan to buy quequisque to sell in the little market in his town to guarantee daily income.

loans.use: to buy quintales of quequisque.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 49 years old and married. She has been manufacturing carpets with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy such as perfumes, makeup, skin treatments, and more.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es estudiante, trabaja en una farmacia, con un ingreso mensual, vive en la casa de su tía quien es la dueña de la farmacia, es un muchacho muy trabajador, responsable se dedica mucho a sus estudios ya que desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para lograr sus objetivos.
Él está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Farmacia Asistencial, y comenta que quiere poder tener su propia farmacia y generar sus propios ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de manutención, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juan is a student. He works in a pharmacy with a monthly income. He lives in his aunt's house, and she owns the pharmacy. He is a very hardworking and responsible young man. He is very dedicated to his studies because he wants to get ahead with his hard work so he can achieve his goals. 

He is studying to get a Bachelor Degree as a Pharmacy Assistant. He says that he wants to have his own pharmacy to generate his own income to help his family. 

He is asking for this loan to invest in paying his living expenses. This way, he can keep going to school.

loans.use: to pay for his living expenses.
